Mail_Content_100001.ContentEN: Thank you for completing the survey! We've prepared a gift for you~

Mail_Content_100002.ContentEN:
Dear Phoxhunter,

Thank you for completing the survey! Please find your reward attached.
We value every piece of feedback and suggestion you provide. Your input is essential in helping us enhance the overall quality of the game.

Mail_Content_100003.ContentEN:
This is a test email containing Bonus Pack 130004 (Intermediate Melee Weapon Demon Wedge bundle)
Expires in 1 day

Mail_Content_100005.ContentEN:
Dear Phoxhunter:
Your unclaimed event rewards have been sent to your inbox. Best of luck on your future commissions.

Mail_Content_10007.ContentEN:
Dear Phoxhunter, 
 
 Here are the details of your rebate from the Second Closed Beta Test:
 • Total Top-up:<H>{TotalRechargeMoney} CNY</> → Rebated as <H>{Phoxene} Phoxene Plumules</>
 • Monthly Pass Rebate: <H>{MonthlyCard} Pass(es)</>
 
 We sincerely thank you for your support of Duet Night Abyss.

Mail_Content_10008.ContentEN:
Dear Phoxhunter,

Thank you for completing the survey! Please find your reward attached.

We value every piece of feedback and suggestion you provide — your input is essential in helping us improve the overall quality of the game.

Mail_Content_10009.ContentEN:
Dear Phoxhunter,

Thank you for filling out the survey. Below are some rewards for you.

We value all feedback and suggestions. Your kind feedback will help us continuously improve the player experience and game quality.

Mail_Content_10011.ContentEN:
Dear Phoxhunter,
The drops rewards you earned by watching Twitch streams have been delivered to your game account.
Please check the attachment below to claim them.

Thank you for your support!

— Duet Night Abyss Team

Mail_Content_10012.ContentEN:
Dear Phoxhunter,
The drops rewards you earned by watching CHZZK streams have been delivered to your game account.
Please check the attachment below to claim them.

Thank you for your support!

— Duet Night Abyss Team

Mail_Content_10014.ContentEN:
Dear Phoxhunter, 
 You've successfully checked in at Lunoloft. Please claim your reward.

Mail_Content_10016.ContentEN:
Dear Phoxhunter,
The following are thought carrying Rebecca's memories.
Please claim them in the attachment.

Mail_Content_100301.ContentEN: An error occurred during reward distribution. The recovered rewards have been reclaimed and delivered to Inventory.

Mail_Content_100401.ContentEN: Dear Phoxhunter, The latest volume of the Bard's Tome is now complete. All unclaimed rewards have been sent to your mailbox. Don't forget to get them!

Mail_Content_100402.ContentEN: Dear Phoxhunter, Your repeated purchase of the Bard's Tome has been refunded in Phoxene Plumule equivalent to your purchase. Thank you for your patience and understanding. Happy gaming!

Mail_Content_101001.ContentEN:
Dear Phoxhunter, 

Unclaimed rewards from the [Luno's Heptameron] event have been sent to your mailbox. Don't forget to get them!

Mail_Content_102001.ContentEN:
Dear Phoxhunter, 

Unclaimed rewards from the [Beginner's Guide for Phoxhunters] event have been sent to your mailbox. Don't forget to get them!

Mail_Content_19101.ContentEN:
Ah, my little minion, you've finally arrived! Took you so long my hair's starting to go grey!
Phoxhunters are all set! Here, take this upfront bounty, and let the adventure on Atlasia commence!

Mail_Title_102001.ContentEN: [Beginner's Guide for Phoxhunters] Claim Your Rewards

Mail_Title_19101.ContentEN: Onward! Invitation from the Demon King!

Message_Guide_Achievement_1.ContentEN: You've completed an achievement. Go claim your reward!

Message_Guide_Achievement_2_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to show the cursor, then select <H>Achievements</> to open the Achievements page

Message_Guide_Achievement_2_Phone.ContentEN: Select <H>Achievements</> to open the Achievements page

Message_Guide_Achievement_3.ContentEN: Take on various challenges and complete more achievements in future adventures!

Message_Guide_Achievement_4.ContentEN: Select "Claim" to claim the Achievement reward

Message_Guide_Achievement_4_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select Claim and collect your rewards

Message_Guide_Achievement_5.ContentEN: Select "Return" to close the Achievements page

Message_Guide_Badge_1.ContentEN: Lunoxplorer has left badges across Atlasia, marking the paths of her journeys. Collect them and return them to her to earn recognition and rewards.

Message_Guide_Bag_1_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to show the cursor, then select <H>Inventory</> to open the Inventory page

Message_Guide_Bag_1_Phone.ContentEN: Tap the <H>Inventory</> icon in the upper left corner to open the Inventory page

Message_Guide_Bag_2.ContentEN: In Inventory, you can view acquired weapons, materials and other items, and also sell any unwanted items.

Message_Guide_BattleBag_1.ContentEN: In a safe spot, you can load up your <H>Tactical Backpack</> with all sorts of items to brace yourself for future battles!

Message_Guide_BattleBag_10.ContentEN: Select here to equip their weapon

Message_Guide_BattleBag_11.ContentEN: Select "×" to exit the loadout page

Message_Guide_BattleBag_12.ContentEN: Drag the Combat Partner Sigil equipped with weapon into Tactical Backpack, and you're all set! Try <H>holding &OpenBattleWheel&</> in battle to summon a Combat Partner!

Message_Guide_BattleBag_12_1.ContentEN: Drag the Combat Partner Sigil equipped with weapon into Tactical Backpack, and you're all set! Try summoning a Combat Partner in battle!

Message_Guide_BattleBag_13_phone.ContentEN: Hold the button to open Tactical Backpack.

Message_Guide_BattleBag_14.ContentEN: Select a Combat Partner Sigil to set the weapon loadout.

Message_Guide_BattleBag_15.ContentEN: You can quickly equip a weapon with Demon Wedges at this page.

Message_Guide_BattleBag_16.ContentEN: Use <H>Combat Partner Sigils</> to summon allies in battle. To do so, first add them to your Tactical Backpack.

Message_Guide_BattleBag_4.ContentEN: <H>Drag</> various items into Tactical Backpack. <H>Hold &OpenBattleWheel&</> during combat to use these items — it's always good to be well-prepared!

Message_Guide_BattleBag_4_1.ContentEN: <H>Drag</> various items into Tactical Backpack. Using these items during combat — it's always good to be well-prepared!

Message_Guide_BattleBag_5.ContentEN: As a token of friendship, <H>Combat Partner Sigils</> can be used in combat to summon partners to help make the battle much easier. Before calling for a Combat Partner with a sigil, let's revisit the <H>Tactical Backpack</>.

Message_Guide_BattleBag_6.ContentEN: First off, let's arm our Combat Partners

Message_Guide_BattleBag_8.ContentEN: Select here to equip weapons for your Combat Partner

Message_Guide_BattleBag_9.ContentEN:
Each Combat Partner can be equipped with only one weapon (either melee or ranged).
Each weapon can be assigned to only 1 Combat Partner.

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_1.ContentEN: Select <H>Armoury</> to open the Armoury screen

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_10.ContentEN: Select a <H>weapon design</> slot to enter the Weapon Design screen

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_10_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select a <H>weapon design</>slot and open the Weapon Design menu

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_12.ContentEN: You can customise the colour of your weapon here.

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_13_Pad.ContentEN: Press to go to the <H>Overall Colouring</> screen

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_14.ContentEN: You can use Premium Dyes to change the overall colour of your weapon.

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_15.ContentEN: Blueprints for Standard Dyes can be obtained from the <H>Beginner's Guide</> in the Combat screen

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_1_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select <H>Armoury</> and enter the Armoury screen

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_3.ContentEN: Select a <H>cosmetic</> slot to open the Cosmetics screen

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_3_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select a <H>cosmetic</> slot and open the Cosmetics screen

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_4.ContentEN: Switch between different cosmetic slots here

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_5.ContentEN: View and put on your accessories

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_6.ContentEN: You can also customise your character's colour scheme.

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_7_Pad.ContentEN: Press to return to the Armoury screen

Message_Guide_ChangeColor_8_Pad.ContentEN: Press to open the <H>Melee Weapons</> menu

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_1.ContentEN: You've just obtained a new weapon. Try it now!

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_10.ContentEN: Select the "+" button multiple times to adjust the desired level of the upgrade

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_11.ContentEN: Upgrading weapons consumes a certain amount of <H>Coins</> and <H>Weapon Manuals</>

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_12.ContentEN: Weapon attributes can be viewed here

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_13.ContentEN: You can access your weapon list here.

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_3.ContentEN: Select "Melee Weapons" to set the melee weapon loadouts

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_3_Pad.ContentEN: Press to open the Melee Weapons screen and configure your loadout

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_4.ContentEN: In Armoury, you can view, replace, or upgrade characters and their melee, ranged, or Consonance weapons.

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_5.ContentEN: Select "Switch" to open the melee weapon list

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_6_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select your newly acquired weapon

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_7.ContentEN: Select "Equip" to switch to this melee weapon

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_7_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select Equip and switch to a melee weapon

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_9_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select Upgrade and enhance your weapon

Message_Guide_Dispatch_01.ContentEN: Various unexpected events happen in this world. When you're stretched thin, you can dispatch your companions on expedition quests to handle these sudden situations for you.

Message_Guide_Dispatch_02.ContentEN: Select here to view the list of dispatchable characters

Message_Guide_Dispatch_02_Pad.ContentEN: Press to view the list of dispatchable characters

Message_Guide_Dispatch_03.ContentEN: You can view the currenrt ongoing expedition quests here.

Message_Guide_Dispatch_04.ContentEN: You can check the details of the selected expedition quest here.

Message_Guide_Dispatch_05.ContentEN: Completing expedition quests grants both standard rewards and extra rewards.

Message_Guide_Dispatch_06.ContentEN: Completing expedition quests in person can lead to a quick acquisition of the standard rewards.

Message_Guide_Dispatch_07.ContentEN: Select here to open the list of dispatchable characters

Message_Guide_Dispatch_07_Pad.ContentEN: Press to open the list of dispatchable characters

Message_Guide_Dispatch_08.ContentEN: You can view the dispatchable characters and their Traits in the list.

Message_Guide_Dispatch_09.ContentEN: Select Auto-Select to dispatch characters immediately

Message_Guide_DungeonSec_1.ContentEN: Each Secret Letter offers six possible rewards across three rarity tiers.

Message_Guide_DungeonSec_2.ContentEN: Upon completion, three out of the six rewards will be randomly presented. You may choose one to claim.

Message_Guide_DungeonSec_3.ContentEN: New Covert Commissions refresh every hour.

Message_Guide_Dungeon_10.ContentEN: You can also customise your team setup by selecting a main character and the right Combat Partners for each challenge.

Message_Guide_Dungeon_10_Pad.ContentEN: Press to customise your team setup by choosing a main character and Combat Partners for each challenge

Message_Guide_Dungeon_11.ContentEN: Select here to open the Preset Team Setup page.

Message_Guide_Dungeon_11_Pad.ContentEN: Press to open the team setup screen

Message_Guide_Dungeon_12.ContentEN: Each team setup must include a main character, melee weapons, and ranged weapons.

Message_Guide_Dungeon_13.ContentEN: Select here to open the <H>Commissions</> screen.

Message_Guide_Dungeon_14.ContentEN: Select here to set up your team

Message_Guide_Dungeon_14_Pad.ContentEN: Press here to set up your team

Message_Guide_Dungeon_15.ContentEN: Select here to save the setup

Message_Guide_Dungeon_15_Pad.ContentEN: Press here to save the setup

Message_Guide_Dungeon_16.ContentEN: Selet here to confirm and save

Message_Guide_Dungeon_16_Pad.ContentEN: Press here to confirm and save

Message_Guide_Dungeon_17.ContentEN: Click here to start the Commission

Message_Guide_Dungeon_18.ContentEN: You can run Commissions with different preset lineups

Message_Guide_Dungeon_1_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to show the cursor, then select <H>Combat</> to open the Combat page

Message_Guide_Dungeon_1_Phone.ContentEN: Tap the <H>Combat</> icon to open the Combat page

Message_Guide_Dungeon_2.ContentEN: Complete various commissions to earn ascension materials, Coins, Demon Wedges, and all sorts of useful resources.

Message_Guide_Dungeon_3.ContentEN: Select "Return" to close the Commissions page

Message_Guide_Dungeon_4.ContentEN: As Phoxhunters, we're tasked with a diverse array of commissions!

Message_Guide_Dungeon_5.ContentEN: Select <H>Commissions</> to take on all kinds of challenges!

Message_Guide_Dungeon_5_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select <H>Commissions</> and take on new challenges

Message_Guide_Dungeon_7.ContentEN: But Noctoyager Manual Commissions do not consume Sanergy.

Message_Guide_Dungeon_8.ContentEN: Edit your preset team setup for Commission battles here.

Message_Guide_Dungeon_8_Pad.ContentEN: Press to edit your team setup for commission battles

Message_Guide_Dungeon_9.ContentEN: This team setup mirrors the one in Armoury — updates made there will apply here as well.

Message_Guide_Fish04.ContentEN: Select here to cast your line

Message_Guide_Forge_1.ContentEN: This is the forging bench. The materials we collect can be forged into various weapons and useful items here!

Message_Guide_Forge_10.ContentEN: That's about it. Time to find Lunosmith, have her make us a Supply Crate — and admire her craftsmanship~

Message_Guide_Forge_2.ContentEN: Before forging, make sure you've got the blueprints and the necessary materials.

Message_Guide_Forge_3.ContentEN: Once you've got everything, use a blueprint and the required materials to kick off the forging process.

Message_Guide_Forge_5.ContentEN: Select here to check the items being forged

Message_Guide_Forge_7.ContentEN: Select "Claim All" to collect all the forged items

Message_Guide_Forge_7_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select "Claim All" to collect all the forged items

Message_Guide_Forge_8.ContentEN: Click anywhere to return to the Forge screen.

Message_Guide_Forge_8_Pad.ContentEN: Press to return to the Forge screen.

Message_Guide_Forge_9.ContentEN: In the Blueprints Compendium, you can view the blueprints you've obtained.

Message_Guide_Forge_9_Pad.ContentEN: In the Blueprints Compendium, you can view the blueprints you've obtained.

Message_Guide_Gacha_1_Gamepad.ContentEN: Select to Retrace once.

Message_Guide_GameEvent_1.ContentEN: Events are now available! Participate in a variety of events to earn exciting rewards.

Message_Guide_GameEvent_2_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to show the cursor, then select <Highlight>Events</> to open the Events page

Message_Guide_GameEvent_2_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select <Highlight>Events</> and open the event screen

Message_Guide_GameEvent_2_Phone.ContentEN: Tap <Highlight>Events</> to open the Events page

Message_Guide_GameEvent_3.ContentEN: Select "Claim All" to collect all available event rewards.

Message_Guide_GameEvent_3_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select "Claim All" and collect all available event rewards

Message_Guide_HardBoss_4.ContentEN: Challenge the Nocturnal Echoes for a chance to earn rewards including Secret Letters.

Message_Guide_Impression_1.ContentEN: Curious about how the rest of Atlasia sees us? Take a gander at the "Impressions" we get across different regions!

Message_Guide_Impression_2.ContentEN: When chatting with people around the world, your <H>choices</> tend to shape the locals' <H>Impressions</> of you.

Message_Guide_Impression_3.ContentEN: Increases in various Impression attributes might bring more intel during interactions or activate side quests, providing support for your adventure.

Message_Guide_Impression_4.ContentEN: <H>Lunoeggy</> admires those with personality. Once you've built up a strong reputation with enough Impression scores, you can challenge <H>Lunoeggy</> in the city to a dice game for a chance to win <H>Lunoeggy's Rewards</>!

Message_Guide_Mail_2_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to bring up the cursor, then click the icon to open the menu.

Message_Guide_Mail_6.ContentEN: We've obtained some <H>Thoughts</>. They carry a companion's memories. Collect enough to unlock the character via <H>Reminiscence</>.

Message_Guide_Mail_9.ContentEN: Click anywhere to return to the Mailbox screen

Message_Guide_Mail_9_Pad.ContentEN: Press to return to the Mailbox screen

Message_Guide_ModLevelUp_1.ContentEN: Enhancing the <H>level of Demon Wedges</> can further empower Daimons and weapons.

Message_Guide_ModLevelUp_4_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select a Demon Wedge

Message_Guide_ModLevelUp_6.ContentEN: Upgrading Demon Wedges <H>significantly boosts your combat powers</>.

Message_Guide_ModLevelUp_7.ContentEN: Upgrading a Demon Wedge <H>increases its required Tolerance</>. Please make sure the whole required Tolerance <H>do not</> exceed the <H>Tolerance cap</> after the Demon Wedge is upgraded.

Message_Guide_ModTendency_1.ContentEN: A character's innate Track can be adjusted using <H>Track-Shift Modules</>.

Message_Guide_ModTendency_10.ContentEN: If you possess a powerful Demon Wedge but are troubled by an <H>incompatible Track</>, consider <H>adjusting the slot's Track</>.

Message_Guide_ModTendency_11.ContentEN: When a character's slot Track <H>aligns with</> a Demon Wedge's Track, the <H>Tolerance</> required for equipping this Demon Wedge is <H>reduced</>.

Message_Guide_ModTendency_4_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select a Demon Wedge Slot

Message_Guide_ModTendency_6.ContentEN: You can use <H>Track-Shift Modules</> to add, modify, or eliminate the innate <H>Track</> of a character's Demon Wedge slot.

Message_Guide_ModTendency_7.ContentEN: Frustrated by the limited Tolerance cap preventing more Demon Wedge configurations? Try keeping an eye on <H>Track</>!

Message_Guide_ModTendency_8.ContentEN: Every character or weapon bears intrinsic traits, leading to varied <H>Tracks</> for their <H>Demon Wedge slots</>.

Message_Guide_ModTendency_9.ContentEN: For a more effective use of <H>Demon Wedges</>, some are specifically crafted with a <H>Track</> tailored to certain individuals.

Message_Guide_Mod_1.ContentEN: <H>Demon Wedges</>, crafted by the Spathatoi of Hyperborea, are portable components that significantly enhance the power of Daimons and weapons once equipped.

Message_Guide_Mod_10.ContentEN: Select a Demon Wedge to check its effects

Message_Guide_Mod_11.ContentEN: Consume <H>Coins</> and <H>Carmine Globules</> to <H>upgrade</> Demon Wedges and greatly enhance their powers. However, upgrading Demon Wedges will also increase the burden they put on the bearer, potentially exceeding the Tolerance cap for equipping.

Message_Guide_Mod_12.ContentEN: Here you can quickly toggle between characters and weapons to adjust their Demon Wedges as needed.

Message_Guide_Mod_13.ContentEN: A Character Demon Wedge can be used by multiple characters. Similarly, the same Weapon Demon Wedge can be used on multiple weapons.

Message_Guide_Mod_14.ContentEN: <H>Upgrade</> your characters and weapons to increase their Tolerance caps.

Message_Guide_Mod_15.ContentEN: Click here to auto-equip Demon Wedges

Message_Guide_Mod_2_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select a Demon Wedge to equip

Message_Guide_Mod_3.ContentEN: Demon Wedges come in two types: <H>Character Demon Wedges</> and <H>Weapon Demon Wedges</>, and they are not interchangeable.

Message_Guide_Mod_4.ContentEN: Demon Wedges provide various enhancement effects; they need to be <H>equipped in slots</> to take effect.

Message_Guide_Mod_6.ContentEN: Demon Wedges contain massive powers, thus imposing a certain strain on the bearer.

Message_Guide_Mod_7.ContentEN: The <H>top left corner</> indicates the <H>required Tolerance</> of this Demon Wedge.

Message_Guide_Mod_8.ContentEN: When Tolerance hasn't reached the cap, you can drag a Demon Wedge into an empty slot to equip it.

Message_Guide_Mod_9.ContentEN: <H>Tolerance</> refers to the capacity of characters and weapons to bear Demon Wedges. The number below represents the Tolerance cap of a character or a weapon.

Message_Guide_OpenArmory_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to show the cursor, then select <H>Armoury</> to open the Armoury page

Message_Guide_OpenArmory_Pad.ContentEN: Press to open the Armoury Menu.

Message_Guide_OpenArmory_Phone.ContentEN: Select <Highlight>Armoury</> to open the Armoury page

Message_Guide_PetTrain_1.ContentEN: Select <H>Armoury</> to open the Armoury screen.

Message_Guide_PetTrain_1_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select <H>Armoury</> and enter the Armoury screen

Message_Guide_PetTrain_4.ContentEN: Geniemons are divided into <H>Active Geniemons</> and <H>Inactive Geniemons</>. Active Geniemons have Trait slots that are gradually unlocked when they're ascended.

Message_Guide_PetTrain_5.ContentEN: Geniemon's Trait level can be increased via <H>Raise</>. You can also transfer Traits between Geniemons via <H>Geniemon Training</>.

Message_Guide_PetTrain_6.ContentEN: Inactive Geniemons cannot join battle, but their Traits can be learned by other Geniemons through Geniemon Training.

Message_Guide_Pet_02.ContentEN: You can attract Geniemons using Treats of varying qualities. The higher the quality, the better your chances of befriending a Geniemon.

Message_Guide_Pet_03.ContentEN: Feeding at the right moment increases your chances, especially if you aim for the <H>central spot</>.

Message_Guide_Pet_05.ContentEN: When the time is right, <H>Press</> to throw the Treat.

Message_Guide_Pet_06.ContentEN: You've successfully befriended this Geniemon! Head to <H>Armoury</> to check out your new pal.

Message_Guide_Pet_07.ContentEN: Select here to open the <H>Geniemons</> page

Message_Guide_Pet_08.ContentEN: Select here to check the Geniemon's abilities

Message_Guide_Pet_08_Pad.ContentEN: Press to view the Geniemon's abilities

Message_Guide_Pet_09.ContentEN: Select here to release a Geniemon. You can use the essence it leaves behind to boost the level of another Geniemon. You can also level up Geniemon directly using nourishing treats.

Message_Guide_Pet_10.ContentEN: Select here to take the selected Geniemon into battle.

Message_Guide_Pet_11.ContentEN: Press &Skill3& to activate Geniemon Support during combat.

Message_Guide_Pet_11_PAD.ContentEN: Press &GamepadUseSkill& + &Skill3& during combat to trigger Geniemon Support

Message_Guide_Pet_11_PHONE.ContentEN: Tap the Geniemon during combat to trigger Geniemon Support

Message_Guide_Quest_1.ContentEN: If you're not sure what to do next, the <H>Quest Notes</> might give you an idea!

Message_Guide_Quest_2_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to show the cursor, then select <H>Quests</> to view the Quest Notes.

Message_Guide_Quest_2_Pad.ContentEN: Press to open your Quest Notes

Message_Guide_Quest_3.ContentEN: Quest Notes show details of all ongoing quests. <H>Quest Navigation</> can help us locate quest targets. Remember, some quests may require the completion of prerequisites to continue.

Message_Guide_Quest_4_Pad.ContentEN: Press to view quest: The Wandering Luno

Message_Guide_Quest_5.ContentEN: Select to Navigate or Stop Navigating

Message_Guide_Quest_5_Pad.ContentEN: Press to track or untrack the selected quest

Message_Guide_ReplaceChar_1.ContentEN: Just now, we've recruited a new companion through Achievements. Now let's bring them into play!

Message_Guide_ReplaceChar_3.ContentEN: Select to open the character list

Message_Guide_ReplaceChar_5.ContentEN: Select"Replace" to confirm swapping in the new character

Message_Guide_ReplaceChar_6.ContentEN: Select the avatars at the top to quickly switch characters

Message_Guide_ReplaceChar_7.ContentEN: Levelling up characters makes them stronger, which consumes a certain amount of <H>Coins</> and <H>Combat Melodies</>.

Message_Guide_ReplaceChar_8.ContentEN: Select the <H>"+" button</> to <H>level up your character</>

Message_Guide_ReplaceChar_9.ContentEN: After swapping or levelling up characters, remember to equip them with the appropriate melee and ranged weaponry.

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_1.ContentEN: After completing an Abyssoid Battle or Encounter, you can select <H>1</> of <H>3 Lampwicks</> to enhance your combat abilities during the current abyss exploration.

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_2.ContentEN: Select the <H>Lampwick</> you'd like to receive

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_3.ContentEN: You can use <H>Embers</> to <H>refresh</> the available Lampwick options.

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_4.ContentEN: The number of <H>Embers</> you possess is showed here

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_5.ContentEN: Collect enough Lampwicks of <H>the same type</> to unlock <H>extra effects</> in Mystic Maze

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_6.ContentEN: Select here to <H>discard the Lampwick reward</> and gain a small amount of <H>Embers</> instead

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_7.ContentEN: Select here to toggle <H>Lampwick</> info between compact and full views

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_8.ContentEN: Open the <H>Exploration Satchel</> page to check your current Lampwicks

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_8_Pad.ContentEN: Press to open the <H>Exploration Satchel</> screen and check your current Lampwicks

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_9.ContentEN: View your <H>Artefacts</> here — compared to Lampwicks, Artefacts provide more independent and often more powerful effects.

Message_Guide_RougeContract_1.ContentEN: Each Abyssward Zone has a Depth Level.

Message_Guide_RougeContract_2.ContentEN: Some zones allow adjustable Depth settings.

Message_Guide_RougeContract_3.ContentEN: Higher total depth increases the bonus Trace Points issued at the end of a run.

Message_Guide_RougeContract_4.ContentEN: Select <H>Confirm</> to save your current Abyssward configuration.

Message_Guide_RougeContract_5.ContentEN: Select <H>Reset</> to cancel and restore previous settings.

Message_Guide_RougeLantern_1.ContentEN: Lighting up the Lantern will enhance its Blessings, boosting your combat abilities during your explosion in Mystic Maze.

Message_Guide_RougeLantern_3.ContentEN: Select a Blessing node to view the <H>enhancements</> it offers

Message_Guide_RougeLantern_4.ContentEN: Consume a certain amount of <H>Glazeystal</> to light up a Blessing node

Message_Guide_RougeLantern_5.ContentEN: You can toggle between different <H>Lantern Blessings</> here.

Message_Guide_RougeLantern_6.ContentEN: Here shows all <H>Artefacts</> and <H>Lampwicks</> collected during the exploration

Message_Guide_RougeLantern_7.ContentEN: Check the amount of <H>Glazeystal</> you've owned here

Message_Guide_RougeLantern_8.ContentEN: Use <H>Glazeystal</> to light up the Lantern and gain <H>Blessings</> to boost your combat power

Message_Guide_RougeLantern_8_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select <H>Glazeystal</> to light up the lantern and gain <H>Blessings</> that enhance your combat ability

Message_Guide_RougeSettlement_1.ContentEN: Here shows the Trace Point you've earned during the exploration, which can be used to unlock weekly rewards.

Message_Guide_RougeSettlement_2.ContentEN: Here shows the Glazeystal you've collected during the exploration, which can be used to light up the Lantern and enhance your combat power in Mystic Maze.

Message_Guide_RougeShop_1.ContentEN: At the <H>Mysterious Merchant</>'s stall, you can spend <H>Embers</> to purchase <H>Lampwicks</> and <H>Artefacts</>.

Message_Guide_RougeShop_2.ContentEN: You can toggle between <H>Lampwicks</> and <H>Artefacts</> here.

Message_Guide_Rouge_1.ContentEN: <H>Mystic Maze</> is now open. Dive into the unknown abyss, empower yourself with various combinations of Lampwicks and Artefacts, and confront formidable foes.

Message_Guide_Rouge_10.ContentEN: Select <H>Start Exploring</> to enter the Mystic Maze and experience a story unfolding elsewhere in the world.

Message_Guide_Rouge_4.ContentEN: Select <H>"Go"</> to enter the Mystic Maze.

Message_Guide_Rouge_4_Pad.ContentEN: Press to select <H>"Go"</> and enter the Mystic Maze

Message_Guide_Rouge_5.ContentEN: You can select the Difficulty here.

Message_Guide_Rouge_6.ContentEN: You can view and claim your rewards in Mystic Maze here. The rewards refresh weekly.

Message_Guide_Rouge_8.ContentEN: You can check tips and tutorials on the Mystic Maze here.

Message_Guide_Rouge_9.ContentEN: Clear each difficulty tier for the first time to earn <H>First Clear Rewards</>.

Message_Guide_Tracking_1.ContentEN: Select here to enable navigation guidance. Follow the markers to reach your destination.

Message_Guide_Tracking_1_PAD.ContentEN: Navigation guidance is shown here. Follow the indicator to reach your destination.

Message_Guide_Tracking_1_PHONE.ContentEN: Tap here to enable navigation guidance. Follow the indicator to reach your destination.

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_1.ContentEN: Sandrealm Meditation lets you revisit and battle past enemies in a controlled environment, helping you familiarise yourself with their moves and hone your combat skills.

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_3.ContentEN: Click here to increase the <H>number of enemies</> spawned.

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_4.ContentEN: If <H>multiple enemies</> are selected, you can adjust their respective spawn numbers here.

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_4_Pad.ContentEN: If <H>multiple enemies</> are selected, you can press to customise their respective spawn numbers

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_5.ContentEN: Select <H>+</> to raise the <H>level of the enemy</>

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_6.ContentEN: You can choose whether to enable the <H>invincibility mode</> here.

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_7.ContentEN: You can choose whether to activate <H>Enemy Active Mode</>. If turned off, enemies will neither move nor attack.

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_8.ContentEN: After setting everything up, select "Spawn" to start the battle.

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_PC.ContentEN: Press &TrainingOpenSetup& to open the Meditation menu

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_Phone.ContentEN: Tap the interact button to open the Meditation Menu

Message_Guide_Treasure_1.ContentEN: While exploring, you may come across pages left behind by unknown hands — each marked with a secret location.

Message_Guide_Treasure_2.ContentEN: Follow the page's clues to the right spot, and a hidden treasure may be yours.

Message_Guide_WeaponTrigger_1.ContentEN: When dealing damage with a weapon, there's a chance to trigger physical <H>Bonus Effect</>. The chance is based on the weapon's <H>Trigger Probability</>.

Message_Guide_WeaponTrigger_2.ContentEN: Different attributes have different <H>bonus effects</>, which can be viewed in <H>Attribute Info</>.

Message_Guide_WeaponTrigger_3.ContentEN: <H>Characters</> contribute to elemental attacks that may trigger elemental Bonus Effects— <H>Hydro, Pyro, Anemo, Electro, Lumino, and Umbro</>. Each elemental <H>Bonus Effect</> inflicts corresponding <H>periodic damage</> on the target.

Message_Guide_WeaponTrigger_4.ContentEN: <H>Weapons</> contribute to the physical attacks that may trigger physical Bonus Effects — <H>Slash, Spike, and Smash</>. Each physical <H>Bonus Effect</> provides corresponding damage boost or improves the effectiveness of weakening the target's Stance.

Message_Guide_WeaponTrigger_5.ContentEN: When dealing damage with a weapon, there's a chance to trigger physical <H>Bonus Effect</>. The chance is based on the weapon's <H>Trigger Probability</>.

Mon_DesDetail_10001001.ContentEN:
In Huaxu, some among the Loongscions have entered covenant with the Nine Chapters of Dafeng, becoming Guards of Yingtian — guardians of the realm. Imbued with the Mandate of Heaven, they chastise the wicked in its name. To many, they are awe-inspiring heroes; to others, a waking nightmare.
 As with the Sable Bi'an, a number of Guards of Yingtian have turned frenzied under the Scourge of Zhuyin's influence — their rampage now a threat to public safety.

Mon_DesDetail_10002001.ContentEN: The senior enforcers of Huaxu. In Huaxu, some among the Loongscions have entered covenant with the Nine Chapters of Dafeng, becoming Magistrates of Yingtian. Imbued with the Mandate of Heaven, they chastise the wicked in its name. To many, they are awe-inspiring heroes; to others, a waking nightmare.

Mon_DesDetail_10003001.ContentEN:
Once guardians of Huaxu, these beasts now run amok — akin to the Bi'an, yet shrouded in black from head to tail. They emerged alongside the Scourge of Zhuyin, their minds clouded and violent, a menace to Huaxu's daily peace.
 Some scholars speculate they may, in truth, be Filthoids.

Mon_DesDetail_10004001.ContentEN:
Guardians of Huaxu and executors of the Nine Chapters' will. They emerge from the cutting winds to punish those who transgress the Nine Chapters' sacred edicts.
 Some scholars speculate they may, in truth, be Filthoids.

Mon_DesDetail_10005001.ContentEN:
In Huaxu, some among the Loongscions have entered covenant with the Nine Chapters of Dafeng, becoming Guards of Yingtian — guardians of the realm. Imbued with the Mandate of Heaven, they chastise the wicked in its name. To many, they are awe-inspiring heroes; to others, a waking nightmare.
 As with the Sable Bi'an, a number of Guards of Yingtian have turned frenzied under the Scourge of Zhuyin's influence — their rampage now a threat to public safety.

Mon_DesDetail_115.ContentEN: As the elite ranks of soldiers, Patrolhawks have the authority to command regular troops and can relay alarm signals to alert others of incoming intruders.

Mon_DesDetail_6001001.ContentEN: One of the most common Filthoids. They excel at rushing towards the target and tearing them to pieces. Their formidable jaws and claws were once considered a significant threat to travellers. While the howl of a wolf might allow room for escape, the hoarse roar of a Filthoid often signals an inevitable demise for the unarmed.

Mon_DesDetail_6002001.ContentEN: One of the most common Filthoids. They excel at ranged suppression. These creatures emit a surplus of hard inorganic matter from their gun-resembling arms, rather than regular ammunition. The details of their mutation remain a mystery, yet their adaptation to the contemporary era is evident.

Mon_DesDetail_6003001.ContentEN: One of the most common Filthoids. They excel at assisting in ranged combat. Often airborne, their sleek, flexible tendrils have led some to unwisely call them "cute". Daring culinary experimenters have tried to turn them into delicacies, usually paying dearly for their naivety.

Mon_DesDetail_6004001.ContentEN: One of the most common large Filthoids. They excel at destroying targets with its powerful body. Deceivingly slow-looking and adorable, they possess a destructive force formidable enough to penetrate state-of-the-art armour.

Mon_DesDetail_6005001.ContentEN: One of the most common Filthoids. They excel at disturbing enemies from a distance. These creatures camouflage themselves with hard, petal-like hyperplasia and wield sticky, corrosive secretions. They lie in ambush from a distance, creating a lingering nightmare for their victims that is impossible to shake off or escape from.

Mon_DesDetail_6006001.ContentEN: One of the most common Filthoids. They excel at collecting items. Often mistaken for mutated Floating Filthoids, these creatures roam freely, swallowing everything they covet. Whether driven by their insatiable phantom hunger or simply mirroring the greed inherent in all creatures remains unknown.

Mon_DesDetail_6007001.ContentEN: One of the most common Filthoids. They excel at enemy containment. These creatures might have stood as titans of thought, weaving brilliance into words upon the page—not weaponizing their "inspirations" into actual flames.

Mon_DesDetail_6011001.ContentEN: One of the most common mutated Filthoids. They excel at rushing towards the target and tearing them to pieces. Their formidable jaws and claws were once considered a significant threat to travellers. While the howl of a wolf might allow room for escape, the hoarse roar of a Filthoid often signals an inevitable demise for the unarmed.

Mon_DesDetail_6012001.ContentEN: One of the most common mutated Filthoids. They excel at ranged suppression. These creatures emit a surplus of hard inorganic matter from their gun-resembling arms, rather than regular ammunition. The details of their mutation remain a mystery, yet their adaptation to the contemporary era is evident.

Mon_DesDetail_6013001.ContentEN: One of the most common mutated Filthoids. They excel at ranged suppression. Often airborne, their sleek, flexible tendrils have led some to unwisely call them "cute". Daring culinary experimenters have tried to turn them into delicacies, usually paying dearly for their naivety.

Mon_DesDetail_6014001.ContentEN: Common large mutated Filthoids. They excel at destroying targets with its powerful body. Deceivingly slow-looking and adorable, they possess a destructive force formidable enough to penetrate state-of-the-art armour.

Mon_DesDetail_6015001.ContentEN: A variant of the Soul-Scorching Filthoid, mutated by the Incense-laced air of Huaxu. Specialised in hindrance and containment, it is often mistaken by passers-by for an innocuous aromatic plant.

Mon_DesDetail_6016001.ContentEN: A variant of the Guerrilla Filthoid, mutated by the Incense-laced air of Huaxu. Adept at long-range suppression. Slender twigs sprout from fissures in its ossified forearms, each tipped with a tight bud — so that the projectiles it launches carry an eerie, perfumed scent.

Mon_DesDetail_6017001.ContentEN: A variant of the Veloci Filthoid, mutated by the Incense-laced air of Huaxu. Its head has transformed into a massive, stigma-like structure, capable of engulfing and rending prey. Specialised limbs allow it to cling to walls and eaves with ease. For a time, its gaping jaws and razor-edged claws posed a grave threat to travellers.

Mon_DesDetail_7001001.ContentEN: The standard snipers of Hyperborea Legions. They excel at ranged suppression. Female snipers make up the majority of the Legion. They provide distant fire support with remarkable endurance, vigilance, and steadiness. Their tailored camo cloaks serve not only as effective concealment but also as a badge of their extraordinary skill.

Mon_DesDetail_7001005.ContentEN:
The target of this commission. 
They can enter Stealth state, making it difficult for opponents to detect them. When their HP is low, they can summon decoys to confuse opponents.

Mon_DesDetail_7002001.ContentEN: The standard offensive troops of Hyperborea Legions. They excel at close-quarters combat. Marked by the distinctive etchings on their chest armour, they skillfully handle formidable swords to cleave and demolish all in their path.

Mon_DesDetail_7002005.ContentEN:
The target of this commission. 
They can use robots to assist them in battle.

Mon_DesDetail_7003001.ContentEN: The standard expeditionary troops of Hyperborea Legions. They are proficient in various combat ranges, their bespoke heavy armour offers both formidable protection and essential support in harsh conditions. These troops are rumoured to appear even in the Empire's most remote wildernesses.

Mon_DesDetail_7003005.ContentEN:
The target of this commission. 
They can leave Landmines behind to disrupt enemies while escaping hunt.

Mon_DesDetail_7004001.ContentEN: The standard assault troops of Hyperborea Legions, serving as guardians at the vanguard. T They excel at close-range reconnaissance and defence against enemy attacks. Their hefty shields, a centuries-old standard, remain emblematic of their role.

Mon_DesDetail_7006001.ContentEN: The standard support devices of Hyperborea Legions. They are capable of hovering around the battlefield and healing wounded soldiers. It relies on a modular design, pieced together to achieve what seems like autonomous operational logic. Its widespread use confirms one of the Alchemy Academy's key principles: that even repetitive and tedious processes can create extraordinary miracles.

Mon_DesDetail_7007001.ContentEN: The standard support devices of Hyperborea Legions. They are capable of briefly stalling and restricting enemies. It relies on a modular design, pieced together to achieve what seems like autonomous operational logic. Its widespread use confirms one of the Alchemy Academy's key principles: that even repetitive and tedious processes can create extraordinary miracles.

Mon_DesDetail_7007002.ContentEN: These devices can momentarily stall and suppress enemies. Built on a modular design, they operate with what appears to be autonomous logic. Their widespread deployment stands as proof of a core principle at the Alchemy Academy: even repetitive, monotonous work — when applied with precision — can give rise to miracles.

Mon_DesDetail_7008001.ContentEN: The standard commanders of Hyperborean Legions. They are highly skilled in solo combat and strategic leadership. They have demonstrated extraordinary prowess in combat, research, or command. Their bespoke weaponry, versatile across different ranges, signifies their skill and status. While their specialties differ, their allegiance to the empire remains constant.

Mon_DesDetail_7009001.ContentEN: The standard enhanced soldiers of Hyperborea Legions. They excel at shattering enemy lines with ruthless efficiency. Clad in the Empire's most advanced armaments by the Emperor's boundless grace, they chew through even the most fortified defenses. No battlefield too dire, no cost too great—they will carve out yet another victory for the Imperial glory.

Mon_DesDetail_7010001.ContentEN: The Spathatoi Alchemists deployed with Hyperborea Legions. More than just battlefield sorcerers, they maintain weapons, treat the wounded, and forge deadlier instruments of war. They are the oil in the gears of Imperial conquest, ensuring the war engine never falters.

Mon_DesDetail_7011001.ContentEN: The specialised snipers of Hyperborea Legions. They excel at ranged suppression. Female snipers make up the majority of the Legion. They provide distant fire support with remarkable endurance, vigilance, and steadiness. Their tailored camo cloaks serve not only as effective concealment but also as a badge of their extraordinary skill.

Mon_DesDetail_7012001.ContentEN: The specialised offensive troops of Hyperborea Legions. They excel at close-quarters combat. Marked by the distinctive etchings on their chest armour, they skillfully handle formidable swords to cleave and demolish all in their path.

Mon_DesDetail_7013001.ContentEN: The standard expeditionary troops of Hyperborea Legions. They are proficient in various combat ranges. their bespoke heavy armour offers both formidable protection and essential support in harsh conditions. These troops are rumoured to appear even in the Empire's most remote wildernesses.

Mon_DesDetail_7014001.ContentEN: The specialised assault troops of Hyperborea Legions, serving as guardians at the vanguard. They excel at close-range reconnaissance and defence against enemy attacks. Their hefty shields, a centuries-old standard, remain emblematic of their role.

Mon_DesDetail_7015001.ContentEN: The standard support devices of Hyperborea Legions are designed to contain enemies. It is an improved variant of Magnetix Drones based on Soul-Scorching Filthoids and operates on a modular design, pieced together to achieve what seems like autonomous operational logic. Its widespread use confirms one of the Alchemy Academy's key principles: that even repetitive and tedious processes can create extraordinary miracles.

Mon_DesDetail_7016001.ContentEN: The standard-issue aircraft of the Hyperborean Legions. Pioneering advances in military engineering gave rise to a new era of unconventional armaments. Designed by the Aeolipile, the Eye of the Legion embodies the Empire's resolve to dominate the skies.

Mon_DesDetail_8001001.ContentEN: The standard gunners of the Elysian Church. They excel at long-distance suppression. They excel at ranged suppression and prefer to stand before their enemies in neat and orderly formations rather than lurking in the shadows and firing at them. The stand in formation, firing under their leader's commands, sacrificing their own flesh and blood for God as they enact His justice.

Mon_DesDetail_8002001.ContentEN: The standard offensive troops of the Elysian Church. They excel at close-quarters combat, wielding silver straight swords and delivering the wrath of God to their enemies up close. They wear blessed chainmail, which wards off disaster with their strength of their faith. Alchemists once sought out the mystery behind the exceptional defensive capabilities of their chainmail, only to discover that it was made of ordinary iron.

Mon_DesDetail_8003001.ContentEN: The standard priests of The Elysian Church. They excel at assisting in ranged combat. The verses they continually recite shroud the battlefield when spoken through their special masks, inspiring the faithful of Elysium. It is said that even a mute person can be heard by God when wearing these masks, as long as their faith is devout enough.

Mon_DesDetail_8500001.ContentEN: The Chief of the Empire's 13th Legion. A formidable force with unknown motives and a relentless determination to reclaim Berenica.

Mon_DesDetail_8501001.ContentEN: Endowed with remarkable resilience, this entity has triumphed across countless battlefields, enduring severe wounds. Far from being subdued by the jagged blades and scars it bears, these challenges have only bolstered its strength, transforming it into a more formidable harbinger of doom.

Mon_DesDetail_8502001.ContentEN: The seed in the frozen soil that has forfeited the opportunity for a gentle descent into the night.

Mon_DesDetail_8503001.ContentEN: A colossal Filthoid lurking in the depths of Glevum Pit, mechanically repeating the behaviour of tunnelling and devouring any glowing objects.

Mon_DesDetail_8505001.ContentEN: The Warden of the Imperial Military Prison wields her chains to chastise evil and her flames to defend justice.

Mon_DesDetail_8509001.ContentEN: The scarlet drape trembles as the icy breeze hums a lament of the Snowfield.

Mon_DesDetail_8510001.ContentEN: Law forged of the heart. The Gritblight veils the heavens in shadow.

Mon_DesDetail_8511001.ContentEN: Law aligned by reason. A cold radiance binds the myriad realms.

Mon_DesDetail_8512001.ContentEN: It is the Beast From the Snowfield, crushing children's homes and melting remnants of the fairy's slumber.

Mon_DesDetail_8513001.ContentEN: To invoke the gods' mercy, the Divine Heralds etch holy words into their skin. In the radiance of faith, suffering transforms into sacred grace.

Mon_DesDetail_8514001.ContentEN: For some Divine Heralds, preaching truth and purifying faith are holy callings. Even fire and lead, when wielded in devotion, become extensions of divine grace.

Mon_DesDetail_8515001.ContentEN: The Devourer is not a single Filthoid, but a grotesque amalgamation—a writhing mass of fused flesh, consuming animals, plants, Filthoids, even men. With brute force, it assimilates all into its ever-growing, malformed body, eternally hunting for its next wretched component.

Mon_DesDetail_9001001.ContentEN: A member of The Forsakens, the "Wildswarm" tier. They excel at close-quarters combat. Common Charon-folk turned warriors, their combat techniques lack refinement, yet their fury—forged in the blood of kin—shall become the blade that shatters chains and breaks the enemy's Hammerblow.

Mon_DesDetail_9002001.ContentEN: A member of The Forsakens, the "Wildswarm" tier. They excel at ranged suppression. ranged suppression and harassment. Those who trespass into their watch face not just cold stares—but arrows from blind spots, striking where vigilance falters.

Mon_DesDetail_9003001.ContentEN: A member of The Forsakens, "The Raven" tier. They are adept at modifying their surrounding environments and setting traps. Viewing life as a game, these "Toymakers" engage in a deadly race with destruction, using their own lives as stakes. They turn the battlefield into their personal "playgrounds" by laying countless traps and watching the players, some of which might evade the clutches of annihilation. They typically collaborate with the "Deceivers" and "Bombaholics" in orchestrating their offensives.

Mon_DesDetail_9005001.ContentEN: A member of The Forsakens, "The Raven" tier. They are highly adept at manipulating explosives. Renowned for their devotion to the art of explosions, these "Bombaholics" are obsessive about perfecting their bombs right up until the final moment before detonation. This relentless pursuit of perfection explains why their bombs tend to be more vulnerable prior to their catastrophic impact. They typically collaborate with the "Deceivers" and "Toymakers" in orchestrating their offensives.

Mon_DesDetail_9006001.ContentEN: A member of The Forsakens, "The Raven" tier. They are adept at disrupting enemy formations and sowing chaos on the battlefield. Those known as "Deceivers" are masters of manipulation and deception. They exploit misinformation to pit adversaries against each other, escalating the chaos of the battlefield. They relish in the widespread havoc they cause with a taunting grin, often at the cost of lives including their own. They typically collaborate with the "Bombaholics" and "Toymakers" in orchestrating their offensives.

Mon_DesDetail_9007001.ContentEN: A member of The Forsakens, the "Wildswarm" tier. They excel at assisting in ranged combat. No operation of The Forsakens unfolds without their agents whispering orders like ghosts and returning with battlefield intelligence like messenger hawks. Through the Empire's darkest alleys they move, threading an invisible net of whispers that connects every fellow forsaken.

Mon_DesDetail_9500001.ContentEN: A notorious and elusive master bandit!

Mon_DesDetail_9501001.ContentEN: The suspicious young man ahead is the thief who stole Margie's money bag. Go catch him now!

Mon_DesDetail_9801001.ContentEN: The northern subspecies of wild wolves have adapted to the frozen wastes with pale winter coats and elongated limbs. When you notice "moving snowbanks" in the wild, know that you're already surrounded by these masterful predators.

Mon_DesDetail_9802001.ContentEN: An ancient and rare species, legend speaks of these rare creatures whose gaze has witnessed eons. Their antlers, steeped in the blood of forgotten wars, carry the weight of continents risen and fallen.

Mon_DesDetail_9803001.ContentEN: These hyperadaptive rodents mutate faster than cities can forget. They thrive in the dark corners of cities, gnawing at the secrets we bury beneath concrete.

Mon_DesDetail_9804001.ContentEN: A waterbird found only in Huaxu, marked by long plumes atop its head. It feeds on fish, hunting by standing motionless on one leg in the shallows and striking with its beak the moment prey drifts too near. Its name comes from its likeness to a fisherman poised at their rod.

Mon_DesDetail_9805001.ContentEN: A ground-dwelling bird found only in Huaxu. Though its wings are too reduced for sustained flight, it can glide remarkable distances. In the right season, males fan their tails in courtship — though both sexes share the same vivid emerald plumage.

Mon_DesDetail_9806001.ContentEN: A small wild boar, named for its compact build. Its meat is tender and fine, lacking the gamey tang of larger boars — a delicacy with which the people of Huaxu honour their guests.

Mon_DesDetail_9807001.ContentEN: If you hear a long, wavering "yip—yaaah" after nightfall in Huaxu, it is almost certainly a fox. Hen-keepers rise to check their coops; hunters slip into the dark. But foxes are masters of feint and misdirection — a catch is never guaranteed.

Mon_DesDetail_9808001.ContentEN: A large deer found only in Huaxu, often seen coursing across plains and wooded slopes. The cloud-soft ruff at its neck gives it its name. Gentle by nature — but best not provoked, unless your ribs can withstand the full force of those antlers.

Mon_DesDetail_9809001.ContentEN: A common Huaxu songbird with a lilting call and a plump, round form. Often seen hopping along branches or scurrying over the ground. A creature much adored by the locals.

Mon_Guide_115_01.ContentEN: <Highlight>Patrolhawks</> are elite soldiers chosen from the Patrollers. Patrolhawks become vigilant when enemies approach and gradually ease off when threats recede.

Mon_Guide_115_02.ContentEN: When a <Highlight>Patrolhawk</> remains vigilant for too long, they will sound an <Highlight>alarm</> and initiate a hostage execution <Highlight>countdown</>.

Mon_Guide_6006001_01.ContentEN: When defeated, <Highlight>Porter Filthoid</> drops <Highlight>Excavator Module</> that keeps the Excavator running.

Mon_Guide_6007001_01.ContentEN: <Highlight>Soul-Scorching Filthoid</> explodes upon defeat, dealing AoE Damage to allied and hostile targets within range.

Mon_Guide_7001005_01.ContentEN: <Highlight>Sniper Private - Stealth</> periodically enters [Stealth] mode, increasing Movement Speed for 4s.

Mon_Guide_7001005_02.ContentEN:
When <Highlight>Sniper Private - Stealth</> takes damage at below 80% Max HP, it enters [Stealth] mode and summons several identical [Decoys]. 
[Decoys]: look the same as <Highlight>Sniper Private - Stealth</> but take increased damage. When any of the [Decoys] is defeated, <Highlight>Sniper Private - Stealth</> will be inflicted with [Slackness]. [Slackness]: Decreases Movement Speed for #2s.

Mon_Guide_7002005_01.ContentEN: When appearing in battle, <Highlight>Cleaving Private - Battlewise</> summons a <Highlight>[Healing Drone]</> and periodically summons a <Highlight>[Magnetix Drone]</> to assist in combat.

Mon_Guide_7002005_02.ContentEN:
<Highlight>Healing Drone</>: Continuously links <Highlight>Cleaving Private - Battlewise</>.
The linked target gains Movement Speed and ATK boosts, and continually recovers HP.

Mon_Guide_7002005_03.ContentEN:
<Highlight>Magnetix Drone</>: Chases down hostile target and self-destructs, and then creates a [Magnetic Storm] centered on itself.
[Magnetic Storm]: deals damage to and inflicts [Slowness] on hostile targets within range.
[Slowness]: Reduces Movement Speed for #1 second. Deals damage to and inflicts [Paralysis] on targets within range.
[Paralysis]: Unable to move or attack for #2s.

Mon_Guide_7003005_01.ContentEN: <Highlight>Expedition Private - Armed Assault</> periodically places a [Landmine] at their current location.

Mon_Guide_7003005_02.ContentEN: [Landmines] activate when hostile units enter their range and detonate after a brief delay, dealing damage and applying [Slackness] to hostile units nearby. [Slackness]: Loses Movement Speed for #1s.

Mon_Guide_7007002_01.ContentEN: Some <Highlight>Magnetix Drones Ⅱ</> will approach vehicles and self-destruct, dealing substantial damage to vehicles and other hostile targets within range.

Mon_Guide_7008001_01.ContentEN: Elite Sergeant can use <Highlight>Morale Boost</> to inspire allies around them.

Mon_Guide_7008001_02.ContentEN: When inspired by the allies, applies [High Morale]. [High Morale]: increases Movement Speed and damage dealt, and decreases damage taken.

Mon_Guide_7008001_03.ContentEN: When the Elite Sergeant is <Highlight>defeated</>, allies lose the [High Morale] effect.

Mon_Guide_7015001_01.ContentEN: <Highlight>Patrol Drone</> explodes upon defeat, dealing AoE Damage to allied and hostile targets within range.

Mon_Guide_8501002_01.ContentEN: Notoriously fierce, <Highlight>Battle Mavens</> use their aberrant abilities to relentlessly pursue their targets upon engagement.

Mon_Guide_8515001_01.ContentEN: While <Highlight>the Devourer</> is casting <Highlight>Spore Burst</> or <Highlight>Scorching Breath</>, striking the <Highlight>glowing spot on its head</> will temporarily stun it.

Mon_Guide_9003001_01.ContentEN:
<Highlight>Toymakers</> belong to the "Soldiers" of The Forsakens.
They are adept at modifying their surrounding environments and setting traps. 
In <Highlight>"Commission: Mediation"</>, once a Toymaker is defeated, <Highlight>Bouncepads</> will appear on the retreat route to facilitate your retreat.

Mon_Guide_9005001_01.ContentEN:
<Highlight>Bombaholics</> belong to the "Soldiers" of The Forsakens. They are highly adept at manipulating explosives. 
In <Highlight>"Commission: Mediation"</>, once a Bombaholic is defeated, the Max HP of <Highlight>Finale Flare</> is reduced by 30%.

Mon_Guide_9006001_01.ContentEN:
<Highlight>Deceivers</> belong to the "Soldiers" of The Forsakens.
They are adept at disrupting enemy formations and sowing chaos on the battlefield. 
In <Highlight>"Commission: Mediation"</>, once a Deceiver is defeated, elite enemies will no longer spawn.

Mon_Guide_9500001_01.ContentEN: <Highlight>Lulu Lunoloot</> appears briefly before attempting to flee. Defeat her quickly to secure a bountiful treasure hoard.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Blood_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Decay</> periodically creates a [Decaying Swamp] around itself.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Blood_02.ContentEN: [Decaying Swamp]: Deals periodic damage to enemies within its radius, while simultaneously healing allies inside.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Burst_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Blast</> periodically triggers an explosion centred on itself, launching nearby hostile units into the air.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Fade_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Wither</> periodically unleashes 3 rotating [Withering Beams].
[Withering Beam]: Lasts for 10s. Circles the Primander, dealing damage to targets on contact and reducing their Sanity.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Frozen_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
When <Highlight>Primander – Frostbite</> is hit by a ranged weapon, it retaliates by firing icicles at the attacker, dealing damage and applying 1 stack of [Slow].
[Slow]: Reduces Attack Speed and Movement Speed for #1s, up to #2 stacks.

Mon_Guide_Strong_IceOrb_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Icehell</> periodically summons an [Icehell] beneath hostile targets.
[Icehell]: Slows targets within its radius, then detonates after #1s, dealing AoE damage to all hostile targets in range.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Kamikaze_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Sacrifice</> explodes upon defeat, dealing damage to all hostile targets within range.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Poison_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Corrosion</> periodically generates a pool of [Venom] beneath its feet.
[Venom]: Inflicts a DEF reduction and deals periodic damage to targets within its area.
Additionally, <Highlight>Primander – Corrosion</> accelerates Serum decay while active.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Reflect_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Glimmer</> periodically applies [Glimmer] to itself.
[Glimmer]: Lasts for #1s. During this time, taking damage will trigger an explosion that deals AoE damage to hostile targets within range.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Revenge_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Revenge</> empowers nearby allies when defeated.
[Empowered]: Increases ATK, DEF, Movement Speed, and Attack Speed for #1s.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Shield_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Guard</> periodically summons a [Guardian Field] around itself.
[Guardian Field]: Lasts for #1s and blocks all incoming hostile bullets and projectiles.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Threefold_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Phantom</> summons #1 [Phantom(s)] at the start of battle.
[Phantom]: Takes increased damage but mirrors its summoner's combat abilities.

Mon_Guide_Strong_ThunderLaser_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Thunderstorm</> periodically summons multiple [Thunder Hells] around itself.
[Thunder Hell]: Spins across the field relentlessly, dealing damage to any hostile target on contact.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Thunder_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Thunderclap</> periodically releases [Electro Orbs] that radiate outward.
[Electro Orb]: Discharges electricity every #1s, dealing damage to nearby hostile targets. Disappears after being attacked.

Mon_Guide_Strong_Vampire_01.ContentEN:
Primanders are powerful entities among the hostile forces that wield unique <Highlight>Primander abilities</>.
<Highlight>Primander – Bloodbath</> restores its own HP when it deals damage.

MonsterRushEvent_Wuyou_DungeonDes01.ContentEN:
A mysterious, sword-bearing Wishen appears from nowhere, blocking your path. Perhaps sensing your potential, they offer to teach you a move or two.
 "Watch closely. I'll only show you once."

MonsterRushEvent_Wuyou_DungeonDes02.ContentEN:
Sunlight dapples through the leaves. A breeze stirs your hair. As though recalling a long-lost afternoon, the little Wishen lets out a drawn-out yawn.
 ...Wait — do Wishen even yawn?

MonsterRushEvent_Wuyou_DungeonDes03.ContentEN: The diligent swordsman and the lazy shepherd — their bickering goes on and on. Here's hoping they don't decide to gang up on you, a lone traveller swept up in their cheerful squabble.

MonsterRushEvent_Wuyou_DungeonDes04.ContentEN:
One talisman... two... three... You watch as the Wishen draws slip after slip from behind their back, like a stage magician fanning endless cards from their sleeve.
 "Not this one... nor that... Where's my Thunder-Wielding Talisman!?"

MonsterRushEvent_Wuyou_DungeonDes05.ContentEN:
Unhurried, a Wishen places their straw hat in your hands and asks you to keep it safe.
 The next instant, you think you see a suited figure rise from their shadow, axe in hand, bellowing — "Who else wants some!?"

MonsterRushEvent_Wuyou_DungeonDes06.ContentEN:
They say Wishen are born of unfinished business. You glance at the companion drifting quietly by your side.
 What wish, you wonder, keeps them tethered to this world?

MonsterRushEvent_Wuyou_DungeonDes07.ContentEN:
If fading away means finally letting go, then sorrowful partings have no place in the Wishen's world.
 Coloured in the hues of the soul, these whimsical spirits gather here — and tomorrow, as ever, will brim with noise and wonder.

MonsterRushEvent_Wuyou_PetDesc_1.ContentEN: A Wishen who wields destructive talismans with ease — though the real mystery is where they're pulling them from.

MonsterRushEvent_Wuyou_PetDesc_2.ContentEN: He seems calm, composed — but cross him, and the consequences may far exceed your expectations.

MonsterRushEvent_Wuyou_PetDesc_3.ContentEN: A master of sword-flight, their blades drift and whirl with effortless grace — the perfect backdrop for a photo, if they'd let you borrow it.

MonsterRushEvent_Wuyou_PetDesc_4.ContentEN: They always drift with a light, unhurried grace — and if you're feeling down, a gentle pat from them might just lift your spirits.

Name_200220.ContentEN: How the Team Got Its Name
