RESOURCE_DESC_12110.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Wanewraith. As the part closest to the wielder, the essence of its design is to ensure optimal "handiness."

RESOURCE_DESC_12111.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Wanewraith. Whether the blade is curved or straight, light or heavy, its edge is honed exclusively for battle.

RESOURCE_DESC_12112.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Pyrothirst. As the part closest to the wielder, the essence of its design is to ensure optimal "handiness."

RESOURCE_DESC_12113.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Pyrothirst. Whether the blade is curved or straight, light or heavy, its edge is honed exclusively for battle.

RESOURCE_DESC_12114.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Tetherlash. As the part closest to the wielder, the essence of its design is to ensure optimal "handiness."

RESOURCE_DESC_12115.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Tetherlash. Whether the blade is curved or straight, light or heavy, its edge is honed exclusively for battle.

RESOURCE_DESC_12116.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Withershade. As the part closest to the wielder, the essence of its design is to ensure optimal "handiness."

RESOURCE_DESC_12117.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Withershade. Whether the blade is curved or straight, light or heavy, its edge is honed exclusively for battle.

RESOURCE_DESC_12118.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Withershade. It embodies the wielder's will — only the strong are entitled to showcase their unique individuality on the battlefield.

RESOURCE_DESC_12119.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Rendhusk. There is no turning back once the trigger is pulled, much like the commitment that seals a decisive moment.

RESOURCE_DESC_12120.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Rendhusk. Sturdy and robust, it doubles effectively as a blunt instrument or a throwable weapon when out of bullets.

RESOURCE_DESC_12121.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Rendhusk. Bullets burst forth from here, as both the barrel and the warrior's heart blaze with unrelenting fervour.

RESOURCE_DESC_12122.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Tumeborn. Sturdy and robust, it doubles effectively as a blunt instrument or a throwable weapon when out of bullets.

RESOURCE_DESC_12123.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Tumeborn. Bullets burst forth from here, as both the barrel and the warrior's heart blaze with unrelenting fervour.

RESOURCE_DESC_12124.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Ruinstem. There is no turning back once the trigger is pulled, much like the commitment that seals a decisive moment.

RESOURCE_DESC_12125.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Ruinstem. Sturdy and robust, it doubles effectively as a blunt instrument or a throwable weapon when out of bullets.

RESOURCE_DESC_12126.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Ruinstem. Bullets burst forth from here, as both the barrel and the warrior's heart blaze with unrelenting fervour.

RESOURCE_DESC_12127.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Wailmaw. There is no turning back once the trigger is pulled, much like the commitment that seals a decisive moment.

RESOURCE_DESC_12128.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Wailmaw. Sturdy and robust, it doubles effectively as a blunt instrument or a throwable weapon when out of bullets.

RESOURCE_DESC_12129.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Wailmaw. Bullets burst forth from here, as both the barrel and the warrior's heart blaze with unrelenting fervour.

RESOURCE_DESC_12130.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Marrowseep. There is no turning back once the trigger is pulled, much like the commitment that seals a decisive moment.

RESOURCE_DESC_12131.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Marrowseep. Sturdy and robust, it doubles effectively as a blunt instrument or a throwable weapon when out of bullets.

RESOURCE_DESC_12132.ContentEN: Crafted with precision from the blueprint of Marrowseep. Bullets burst forth from here, as both the barrel and the warrior's heart blaze with unrelenting fervour.

RESOURCE_DESC_122.ContentEN: A recurring Phoxene delivery arranged through Lunotress. Grants a daily supply for the duration of the subscription.

RESOURCE_DESC_123.ContentEN: A neatly bound Hardcover Edition compiling once-scattered stanzas.

RESOURCE_DESC_124.ContentEN: A finely bound Collector's Edition compiling once-scattered stanzas.

RESOURCE_DESC_125.ContentEN: Redeemable for one Geniemon of your choice from the Lore Compilation reward pool. A testament to your journey, and a token of gratitude.

RESOURCE_DESC_19000.ContentEN: Where countless threads of the heart entwine, a Soulprint takes form — Tapestry.

RESOURCE_DESC_19001.ContentEN: Where threads of the heart entwine, a Soulprint takes form — Joy.

RESOURCE_DESC_19002.ContentEN: Where threads of the heart entwine, a Soulprint takes form — Sorrow.

RESOURCE_DESC_19003.ContentEN: Where threads of the heart entwine, a Soulprint takes form — Fear.

RESOURCE_DESC_19004.ContentEN: Where threads of the heart entwine, a Soulprint takes form — Anger.

RESOURCE_DESC_19005.ContentEN: Where threads of the heart entwine, a Soulprint takes form — Trust.

RESOURCE_DESC_19006.ContentEN: Where threads of the heart entwine, a Soulprint takes form — Serenity.

RESOURCE_DESC_19007.ContentEN: Where threads of the heart entwine, a Soulprint takes form — Uncertainty.

RESOURCE_DESC_19008.ContentEN: Where threads of the heart entwine, a Soulprint takes form — Longing.

RESOURCE_DESC_200.ContentEN: A highly valuable ornate statue specially designed for holding Crystallo.

RESOURCE_DESC_20001.ContentEN: Keratin grown from the skin of Filthoids, forming their hardest armor. Processed with special techniques, it can be used for protection in weapons and armor.

RESOURCE_DESC_20002.ContentEN: A shattered Sal Volatile bottle with deep scratches and bullet holes. Its contents leaked out but the glass bottle can be recycled.

RESOURCE_DESC_20003.ContentEN: Cleansing Water used by the Elysian Church devotees to cleanse their hands before ceremonies, usually kept in blessed containers inside temples.

RESOURCE_DESC_20004.ContentEN: Carried by Hyperborean soldiers, engraved with their name, rank, legion, and enlistment date. If a soldier falls in battle, their legion uses the name plate to identify them, and it is sent back to their hometown as a mark of honour.

RESOURCE_DESC_20005.ContentEN: Natural stone powder, commonly used as a consumable in alchemy and construction. The type of ore varies in colour due to geographical differences, making it a primary material for paint pigments.

RESOURCE_DESC_20006.ContentEN: Parchment scrolls carried by Elysian knights, inscribed with blessings and prayers. Knights draw strength from these blessings in battle.

RESOURCE_DESC_20007.ContentEN:
A roll of cable with a Hyperborean mark, collected in a somewhat brutal way. 
Be careful of electric shocks before the sparks die out.

RESOURCE_DESC_20008.ContentEN: Solid crystals harvested from rare Filthoids. Commonly used for intricate research into the biology of these enigmatic creatures.

RESOURCE_DESC_20009.ContentEN:
Common wild plants. The flowers are usually muti-petaled, bright red, and glossy. They are hardy, drought-resistant, and adaptable, hence widespread across the continent. 
They are said to be the tears Father Ask shed for the deceased Mother Embla during his journey to find her in Charon's mythology.

RESOURCE_DESC_2001.ContentEN: It's the testament to your journey through thick and thin, the echoes of your laughter and tears, and the essence of your hard-earned wisdom — remember? You are neither frail nor alone.

RESOURCE_DESC_20010.ContentEN:
A creeping plant commonly found in shaded areas, highly flexible with intertwined fibers. After processing, they are used in various applications, and they are durable and resistant to wear. 
Said to be the inspiration for cable design.

RESOURCE_DESC_20011.ContentEN: A thick grease extracted from Filthoids. Its viscosity often correlates with the Filthoid's strength.

RESOURCE_DESC_20012.ContentEN: Produced from the Elysian Church. Their knight's standard attire has a fine chainmail made of numerous delicate chains. The clanking of the chainmail is the best declaration of battle as the knights march.

RESOURCE_DESC_20013.ContentEN: A currency unique to the Lunos, often given as a thank-you gift by those seeking help.

RESOURCE_DESC_20014.ContentEN: Snowswift is a bird native to cold regions, commonly seen around Icelake. Known for their blistering speed in flight, these elusive creatures are rarely spotted by the naked eye, except during snowfalls when they perch quietly on branches or nestle in their nests. Historically, their tough feathers were prized for crafting traditional quills. Today, however, only a handful of traditionalists and those less fortunate continue to use these economical, albeit less durable, feather pens.

RESOURCE_DESC_20015.ContentEN: A replaceable metal armor from the Hyperborean Empire on soldiers' standard uniforms, usually fitted at joints, with excellent shock resistance, and has been mass-produced. Two spare armors are now standard for a Hyperborean assault soldier.

RESOURCE_DESC_20016.ContentEN: Produced from the Elysian Church, a shield-shaped ornament worn by the Elysian Church soldiers. It's believed to be imbued with divine blessings, symbolizing the will to protect the church.

RESOURCE_DESC_20017.ContentEN: Produced from Hyperborea. Ensuring the legion's mobility has always been a key subject to the Aeolipile. Vehicle armor, serving as an external accessory, withstands extreme weather and allows the vehicle to hold up longer under gunfire. It can be quickly removed for full-speed advance.

RESOURCE_DESC_20018.ContentEN:
The Statue of the Goddess of Fate built by the Elysian Church, now too damaged to discern its original form, but still exuding elegance among its ruins. 
Over time, new sprouts grow here. Under the decoration of vitality, myths never seem to fade.

RESOURCE_DESC_20019.ContentEN: A concentrated combustion aid developed by the Alchemy Academy. A pungent, colourless liquid dyed red to denote danger. Used only in military or industrial settings. A few spoonfuls can send a fireplace's flames roaring up the chimney, and that's definitely an unwanted spectacle.

RESOURCE_DESC_2002.ContentEN:
Verses inspired from the stories of your adventure. Once all have been found, a new ballad shall emerge.
Transcribed and adapted by Lirico, these lines ride the wind and falling leaves, echoing through the skies of Atlasia — sung by bards, shaped by your every step.

RESOURCE_DESC_20020.ContentEN: A common industrial material. A viscous white latex-like liquid that maintains a balance in temperature. Given the unpredictability of terrain and climate on adventures, carrying a few cans is wise. The manufacturer recently introduced fruit and floral scents, so consumers are hereby warned to beware of accidental ingestion.

RESOURCE_DESC_20021.ContentEN: Candles used in church ceremonies, accompanied by devoutly crafted candlesticks. Though their burn time is brief, their light suffices to illuminate the face of divine.

RESOURCE_DESC_20022.ContentEN:
One of the alchemical products of the Hyperborean Empire. A liquid metal that seems like it could flow through your fingers at any moment. Made using a complex purification process. It's usually employed in the military industry.
If you can't handle their melting point, it is recommended not to heat them recklessly.

RESOURCE_DESC_20023.ContentEN: A special product from the other side of the desert. It can be crafted into exquisite decorations or used to strengthen components. The final quality depends on how much real sand gets mixed in during transportation—since it is hard to distinguish between the two, deal with trusted merchants if necessary.

RESOURCE_DESC_20024.ContentEN:
A tentacle obtained from Filthoids, must be cleaned of mucus before use. They are very tough and have strong adhesive properties, sometimes used as fixation devices. 

These walking materials are everywhere, but not many can make them lie still on the chopping board.

RESOURCE_DESC_20025.ContentEN: A precision instrument made by the Hyperborean Empire, still intact despite being covered in scratches and pry marks.

RESOURCE_DESC_20026.ContentEN:
A book with intricate decorations, appears to be a valuable collection of poems, but is actually a codebook for deciphering internal legion radio communications. 
Unfortunately, the inner pages are damaged, leaving only some irrelevant secret codes that can't really be used to decrypt telegrams.

RESOURCE_DESC_20027.ContentEN: Produced from the Elysian Church, a honey-like oily liquid that increases the sharpness of cold weapons and also maintains firearms. Almost every soldier of the assembly carries a few bottles with them, and during breaks, they can be seen carefully applying the potion to their weapons and silently reciting prayers for repelling enemies.

RESOURCE_DESC_20028.ContentEN: Produced from the Hyperborean Empire, a type of modified bullet that can explode. Equipped with a variety of interchangeable heads for different functional needs, experts can use different bullet characteristics to explode exactly where they want.

RESOURCE_DESC_20029.ContentEN: A widely used auxiliary bracket equipped with various clasps for a stable structure, allowing craftsmen to fix weapons on it for adjustment.

RESOURCE_DESC_2003.ContentEN:
Earned by completing daily tasks. Use it to claim your daily reward.
From grand quests to the simplest errands, each mark brings you closer to your goal — proof that no effort goes unnoticed.

RESOURCE_DESC_20030.ContentEN: A specialized spraying device for equipment, used to uniformly apply rust-proofing agents to extend the durability of equipment, and increase the performance of some weapons. Mixing it up with serum injectors can have severe consequences, so it must be used with caution.

RESOURCE_DESC_20031.ContentEN: A polymer made from the concentrated tissues of Filthoids, resembling a tumor and surrounded by some tentacles, supposedly. The methods of producing and using Filthoid polymers apparently originated from the Spathatoi.

RESOURCE_DESC_20032.ContentEN: A cold liquid collected from the north, stored in special containers. Even at room temperature, ice crystals form on the surface of the container. This notion, often found in poetry, is now used as a coolant.

RESOURCE_DESC_20033.ContentEN:
A sigil for cancelling summons.
The companionship might be fleeting, yet the friendship endures. Perhaps the next reunion is merely a heartbeat away.

RESOURCE_DESC_2004.ContentEN:
Verses inspired from the stories of your adventure. Once all have been found, a new ballad shall emerge.
Transcribed and adapted by Lirico, these lines ride the wind and falling leaves, echoing through the skies of Atlasia — sung by bards, shaped by your every step.

RESOURCE_DESC_2007.ContentEN: A book about the use of weapons, it looks very thick, and this accumulation will turn into your strength.

RESOURCE_DESC_201.ContentEN: Produced from the Hyperborean Empire, a precision instrument very similar to a toolbox. When its gears start to move, the Demon Wedge placed inside will be modified to better suit the user's state. Because it acts directly on the user, this style has higher precision, and after use, it can further enhance the user's abilities.

RESOURCE_DESC_2011.ContentEN: A single sheet of music, recording heroic epics passed among minstrels, filled with many handwritten annotations and modifications. To fully express their views, poets didn't hesitate to use tiny writing to exchange and debate in every blank space on the paper, where numerous perspectives are established and then overturned, making reading the entire piece a thrilling experience.

RESOURCE_DESC_202.ContentEN: Produced from the Hyperborean Empire, a precision instrument very similar to a toolbox. When its gears start to move, the Demon Wedge placed inside will be modified to better suit the user's state. This style has good detection capabilities for various types of weapons, and its use can further increase the weapon's abilities.

RESOURCE_DESC_203.ContentEN: Everything is destined to burn, to be devoured and reduced to ashes, ultimately sinking into the abyss.

RESOURCE_DESC_204.ContentEN: A tonic developed by the Alchemy Academy to enhance stamina. Commonly issued as part of standard military supplies.

RESOURCE_DESC_205.ContentEN: What remains of a forebear's shattered lantern, the holy blessings bestowed on it long since eroded by the abyss.

RESOURCE_DESC_20500.ContentEN: A little key that someone left behind. It can be used to open a locked chest.

RESOURCE_DESC_20510.ContentEN: Judging from its texture, it seems to be a fragment coming from the Statue of the Goddess of Fate in Arcane Ruins of Purgatorio Island. Maybe something good would happen once it's used to fix the statue.

RESOURCE_DESC_20511.ContentEN: Primitive ores scattered in the wild; might be somewhat valuable with some forging.

RESOURCE_DESC_20512.ContentEN: A silver coin without owner. It's hard to find its owner.

RESOURCE_DESC_20513.ContentEN: Though not precious in the eyes of the refining market, these clear and sparkling ores hold the heart's true value, which can become the first piece of jewelry given to a beloved one.

RESOURCE_DESC_20514.ContentEN: An old shield. It was discarded for no reason.

RESOURCE_DESC_20515.ContentEN: A long lost medal. Its former owner once used it to exchange current coins.

RESOURCE_DESC_20516.ContentEN: When it comes to waste items, the first things that always come to mind are empty bottles and cans. Collecting a small amount and selling them can help people maintain basic food and clothing, but that's all it can do.

RESOURCE_DESC_20517.ContentEN: It can be used to make simple tools or for heating, the most basic things for survival in the wilderness.

RESOURCE_DESC_20518.ContentEN: A gemstone that has rested on the hand of a goddess statue on Purgatorio Island for a very long time. If it could speak, it would surely have many stories to tell, but it is, in fact, just a radiant and splendid gem.

RESOURCE_DESC_206.ContentEN:
Increases commission rewards by 100%.
 As your team, The Noctoyagers, rise to prominence among the Phoxhunters, more and more commissions come your way. While this entails heavier responsibilities, it also leads to greater rewards.

RESOURCE_DESC_207.ContentEN:
Increases commission rewards by 200%.
 As your team, The Noctoyagers, rise to prominence among the Phoxhunters, more and more commissions come your way. While this entails heavier responsibilities, it also leads to greater rewards.

RESOURCE_DESC_208.ContentEN:
Increases commission rewards by 800%.
 As your team, The Noctoyagers, rise to prominence among the Phoxhunters, more and more commissions come your way. While this entails heavier responsibilities, it also leads to greater rewards.

RESOURCE_DESC_209.ContentEN:
Increases commission rewards by 2000%.
 As your team, The Noctoyagers, rise to prominence among the Phoxhunters, more and more commissions come your way. While this entails heavier responsibilities, it also leads to greater rewards.

RESOURCE_DESC_210.ContentEN: A coin stamped with the emblem of a fish — treasured by anglers far and wide. The more you collect, the higher you climb in the fishing ranks. Trade them in for better gear and prove yourself the slickest fish hunter out there.

RESOURCE_DESC_211.ContentEN: For Phoxhunters, gathering whispers and weaving clues are part of the craft. With persistent cultivation and accumulation, a steady stream of commissions will soon follow.

RESOURCE_DESC_214.ContentEN: A ticket stub from the Theatre, which can be used to exchange for items at the "Theatre Gift Shop."

RESOURCE_DESC_215.ContentEN: Forged in the crucible of alchemists' madness, it hones the talents embedded in one's bloodline through absolute rationality. Can be used to exchange for Consanance Weapon Demon Wedges.

RESOURCE_DESC_29001.ContentEN: Advensphere said to lie scattered across Purgatorio Island. They stand as proof of courage, wisdom, and patience — virtues forged through the trials of adventure. Gather enough and present them to the Lunoxplorer in Icelake's town square to earn valuable rewards.

RESOURCE_DESC_29002.ContentEN: Advensphere said to lie scattered across Icelake. They stand as proof of courage, wisdom, and patience — virtues forged through the trials of adventure. Gather enough and present them to the Lunoxplorer in Icelake's town square to earn valuable rewards.

RESOURCE_DESC_29003.ContentEN: Advensphere said to lie scattered across Lonza Fortress. They stand as proof of courage, wisdom, and patience — virtues forged through the trials of adventure. Gather enough and present them to the Lunoxplorer in Icelake's town square to earn valuable rewards.

RESOURCE_DESC_29004.ContentEN: Tokens said to lie scattered across the lands of Huaxu — proof of courage, wisdom, and patience, each forged through trials of adventure. Gather enough, and present them to the Lunoxplorer in Haze Market to earn valuable rewards.

RESOURCE_DESC_3000001.ContentEN: A box of paper stars crafted from expired tickets. It's said that a certain number of these can bless one's wishes and dreams, though this seems not to be the case.

RESOURCE_DESC_3000002.ContentEN: A piece of worn clothing, hiding a palm-sized diary within its thin lining. The name "Alice" is legible on the cover, but most entries are lost to stains, with only recent scribbles faintly recognisable.

RESOURCE_DESC_3000003.ContentEN: A worn adventure novel depicting the protagonist and his lean horse conquering a castle to find treasure.

RESOURCE_DESC_3000004.ContentEN: A wire sculpture of Berenica in profile, skillfully capturing her defining features.

RESOURCE_DESC_3000005.ContentEN: A standard-issue medical kit used by the Legion. It contains the essentials for treating minor battlefield injuries, but offers little help for more severe trauma.

RESOURCE_DESC_3000006.ContentEN: A cherished keepsake Avar always carries, showing him with his daughter Daphne as a child. Though yellowed with age, their bright smiles remain unmistakable.

RESOURCE_DESC_3000007.ContentEN: Once a cherished keepsake Avar carried with him, featuring a blissful moment of him with his daughter Daphne as a child. Now, their bright smiles are smeared by dark, dried bloodstains.

RESOURCE_DESC_3000008.ContentEN: A flower given to you by Psyche, with the warmth of her touch still lingering on the stem.

RESOURCE_DESC_3000009.ContentEN: A seemingly simple prescription that conceals a dangerous secret — seditious text hidden on the back. If ever discovered by Imperial eyes, it could spell disaster.

RESOURCE_DESC_3000010.ContentEN: An abstract portrait gifted to you by Faye, who insists it's your likeness. The interplay of red and white might vaguely suggest a human form, gender indistinguishable, but if Faye sees you in it, then so be it. Perhaps the aesthetic sensibilities of Inner City denizens are an acquired taste.

RESOURCE_DESC_3000011.ContentEN: An intricately crafted key, oddly familiar yet unplaceable. Its origin remains elusive, but perhaps one day, at the right moment, it will unlock a long-buried secret.

RESOURCE_DESC_30001.ContentEN: Gelatinous substance for crafting Track-Shift Modules. With a pure, water-soluble composition that deactivates at high temperatures, it demands exacting storage conditions. Its utility makes it worth carrying though.

RESOURCE_DESC_30002.ContentEN: Material for crafting Weapon Track-Shift Modules. These specially treated magnets respond to diverse metal components at unique frequencies, allowing seasoned users to discern the most subtle irregularities in weaponry through their vibrations.

RESOURCE_DESC_3001.ContentEN:
Used for re-rolling following a failed Impression Check in Hyperborea.
Human interactions are invariably fraught with difficulties. Face them head-on and try again.

RESOURCE_DESC_3002.ContentEN:
A treat favoured by Geniemons, can be used to feed them.
True to its name, if these creatures could speak, they would surely exclaim, "Yum!"

RESOURCE_DESC_3003.ContentEN:
A treat most-favoured by Geniemons, can be used to feed them.
True to its name, if these creatures could speak, they would surely exclaim, "Yum-yum!"

RESOURCE_DESC_3004.ContentEN:
A nourishing treat favoured by Geniemons. Grants 100 EXP when used to upgrade these helpful companions.
True to its name, if Geniemons could talk, they'd definitely exclaim: "Yum!"

RESOURCE_DESC_3005.ContentEN:
A nourishing treat favoured by Geniemons. Grants 300 EXP when used to upgrade these helpful companions.
True to its name, if Geniemons could talk, they'd definitely exclaim: "Yum-yum!"

RESOURCE_DESC_3006.ContentEN:
A nourishing treat favoured by Geniemons. Grants 1000 EXP when used to upgrade these helpful companions.
True to its name, if Geniemons could talk, they'd definitely exclaim: "Yum-yum-yum!"

RESOURCE_DESC_3007.ContentEN:
A creamy beverage favoured by Geniemons — ideal ascending them.
True to its name, if Geniemons could talk, they'd definitely exclaim: "Yum-yum!"

RESOURCE_DESC_3008.ContentEN:
A beloved snack among Geniemons. Feed one this treat, and it'll twist into an Eldritch Geniemon.
 So tasty, it's literally transformative.

RESOURCE_DESC_3010.ContentEN: Boosts a character's Benefit Impression in Icelake

RESOURCE_DESC_30101.ContentEN: A dye made by blending various raw materials, capable of producing hues akin to those of the waters of Lamenting Lake.

RESOURCE_DESC_30102.ContentEN: A dye made by blending various raw materials, capable of producing hues akin to those of sea salt.

RESOURCE_DESC_30103.ContentEN: A dye made by blending various raw materials, capable of producing hues akin to those of timber.

RESOURCE_DESC_30104.ContentEN: A dye made by blending various raw materials, capable of producing hues akin to those of peas.

RESOURCE_DESC_30105.ContentEN: A dye made by blending various raw materials, capable of producing hues akin to those of dunes.

RESOURCE_DESC_30106.ContentEN: A dye made by blending various raw materials, capable of producing hues akin to those of red clay.

RESOURCE_DESC_30107.ContentEN: A dye made by blending various raw materials, capable of producing hues akin to those of rouge.

RESOURCE_DESC_30108.ContentEN: A dye made by blending various raw materials, capable of producing hues akin to those of the feathers of a raven.

RESOURCE_DESC_30109.ContentEN: A dye made by blending various raw materials, capable of producing hues akin to those of a thunderstorm on the horizon.

RESOURCE_DESC_3011.ContentEN: Boosts a character's Morality Impression in Icelake

RESOURCE_DESC_30110.ContentEN: A dye made by blending various raw materials, capable of producing hues as mesmerizing as the galaxy.

RESOURCE_DESC_30111.ContentEN: A dye made by blending various raw materials, capable of producing hues reminiscent of wheat fields.

RESOURCE_DESC_30112.ContentEN: A blended dye crafted from myriad ingredients, capable of producing any colour the eye can imagine.

RESOURCE_DESC_3012.ContentEN: Boosts a character's Wisdom Impression in Icelake

RESOURCE_DESC_3013.ContentEN: Boosts a character's Empathy Impression in Icelake

RESOURCE_DESC_3014.ContentEN: Boosts a character's Chaos Impression in Icelake

RESOURCE_DESC_40001.ContentEN: A vial of Sal Volatile, an essential in any first aid kit. In moments of faintness from illness or pain, it can grant a brief lucidity.

RESOURCE_DESC_40003.ContentEN: A supply crate brimming with bullets, which both saves and ends lives on the battlefield.

RESOURCE_DESC_4010001.ContentEN: A subspecies of butterfly in Atlasia, its verdant hue heralds the arrival of spring.

RESOURCE_DESC_4010002.ContentEN: A subspecies of butterfly in Atlasia, its indigo hue is pure and striking.

RESOURCE_DESC_4010003.ContentEN: This clear, tasteless spring water is believed to be a divine gift in Elysium, said to cleanse the soul and wash away worldly impurities.

RESOURCE_DESC_4010004.ContentEN:
A type of fungus capable of surviving in extreme cold. Its appearance often leads people to mistake it for a pile of unmelted snow. Its toxins can cause hallucinations if ingested, and in severe cases, can be life-threatening.

DO NOT EAT! DO NOT EAT! DO NOT EAT!

RESOURCE_DESC_4010005.ContentEN: A liquid derived primarily from Phoxene, serving as the most important energy source powering the entire Hyperborean Empire. Its uses extend far beyond what is commonly known.

RESOURCE_DESC_4010006.ContentEN: A common flower found across Atlasia, used in both medicine and as a natural dye.

RESOURCE_DESC_4010007.ContentEN: Seashells are washed up on the beach every day, but finding one intact and vibrantly coloured is always a small stroke of luck.

RESOURCE_DESC_4010008.ContentEN:
This cold-loving freshwater plant is known as the "winter lotus." Its seeds are transparent and as dreamy and fragile as foam.

IT'S TOXIC! HIGHLY TOXIC! EXTREMELY TOXIC!

RESOURCE_DESC_4010009.ContentEN: A compact emergency energy source essential for large-scale facilities. Preloaded with stabilised Phoxichor, the unit remains functional for extended periods. Simply insert it into a machine's designated power slot to activate.

RESOURCE_DESC_4010010.ContentEN: A common wildflower with no formal name, known by different nicknames across regions. No one cultivates it on purpose, and few even notice it — but no matter how often it's plucked, it always grows back in droves. Its resilience is nothing short of remarkable.

RESOURCE_DESC_4010011.ContentEN: A plant that thrives in the cracks of stone and brick. It favours damp, shaded places, but withstands intense radiation, cold, drought, and poor soil with surprising ease. Some households even scatter Sacral Bellflower seeds along their walls — and by the following year, those same walls will be draped in a lush, living tapestry of natural ornamentation.

RESOURCE_DESC_4010012.ContentEN: Commonly found in areas with dense tree cover. In some remote regions, bird eggs are a popular breakfast item. Just don't go stealing any from the nests near your home — if the mother bird catches you, your windows may never be clean again.

RESOURCE_DESC_4010013.ContentEN: An edible fungus known for its savoury taste and widespread presence across the continent. Nearly every culture has its own unique way of preparing it.

RESOURCE_DESC_4020001.ContentEN: Sizable brown nuts, also edible — if one can crack their rock-hard shell like a rodent.

RESOURCE_DESC_4020002.ContentEN: A rarer variant of Ironshell Nuts, also edible. They are richer in oil content than the common variety. When roasted, they burst open, making them a popular snack among kids.

RESOURCE_DESC_4020003.ContentEN: A silvery mineral with a metallic lustre that ranges from black to silver depending on its purity. It is widely used in the manufacture of dyes and pigments.

RESOURCE_DESC_4020004.ContentEN: A rarer variant of Silverite, mixed with impurities that unexpectedly enhance its lustre. It is widely used in the manufacture of dyes and pigments.

RESOURCE_DESC_4020005.ContentEN: With a scientific name "Lakestone," this stone is commonly known as the "Plop Plop Stone" due to its widespread use in stone-skipping games. The number of "plops" made across the water is crucial in determining who gets to be an aspiring leader among the local kids.

RESOURCE_DESC_41002.ContentEN: No one's here. Just a cardboard box.

RESOURCE_DESC_41005.ContentEN: No one's here. Just a cardboard box.

RESOURCE_DESC_41006.ContentEN: No one's here. Just a cardboard box.

RESOURCE_DESC_41014.ContentEN: After a headlong sprint, savour a moment of stillness.

RESOURCE_DESC_5011010.ContentEN: A key commercial species across Atlasia, this fish can be found in every sea. It forms vast schools in the open ocean and migrates to coastal shallows with the turning of the seasons, year after year.

RESOURCE_DESC_5011020.ContentEN: A brilliantly coloured fish found in crystal-clear waters, easily recognised by the vivid spines along its back. Skittish by nature — when fishing, patience serves better than speed.

RESOURCE_DESC_5011030.ContentEN: A slender marine fish that swims upright, its scales gleaming like liquid silver in motion — true to its name. Unfortunately, it perishes quickly once removed from the water, and due to the high cost of transport, it is seldom seen on inland tables.

RESOURCE_DESC_5012010.ContentEN: Named for the long barbels near its mouth, this freshwater species dwells in muddy beds thick with waterweed. It only surfaces after sundown to feed and can live for decades — if it avoids the hook.

RESOURCE_DESC_5012020.ContentEN: Densely covered in pearl-like spots, this fish can grow up to two metres long. The young are gentle by nature and rarely stray far from their parents' tailfins.

RESOURCE_DESC_5012030.ContentEN: Found throughout freshwater bodies, the Shellgnarl is one of the few ingredients beloved by nearly every community on the continent. Preparation methods vary by region — some even throw grand summer festivals featuring it as the star dish.

RESOURCE_DESC_5013010.ContentEN: With its sharp fangs and perpetually scowling face, this fish looks far more dangerous than it actually is. The largest one ever recorded measured just 5 centimetres. It doesn't hunt in packs, and its bite is harmless — at most leaving a faint, circular scar.

RESOURCE_DESC_5013020.ContentEN: A near-motionless fish that spends most of its life lying sideways in the silt. With its mouth perpetually agape, it waits for plankton and small fish to drift in. Once it bites, it chews for hours without so much as a twitch — a habit that gave it its name.

RESOURCE_DESC_5013030.ContentEN: A bizarre creature that looks like a crab crossed with a spider. It scuttles up walls like the latter and haunts the depths like the former. While there are many ways to catch one, angling remains by far the safest.

RESOURCE_DESC_5021010.ContentEN: A tiny jellyfish found only in the waters around Purgatorio Island, known for its bioluminescence. Though inedible, its glow lights the waves on moonless nights — bobbing like a star set adrift, guiding fishermen home.

RESOURCE_DESC_5021020.ContentEN: One of the primary catches for villagers on Purgatorio Island, prized for its tender, flavourful flesh — the result of a life spent in constant motion, ceaselessly chasing the ebb and flow of the tides.

RESOURCE_DESC_5021030.ContentEN: Native to Purgatorio Island, this species can glide across the water's surface. On clear days, you might spot them leaping into the air like birds — their vibrant wings shimmering in the sun.

RESOURCE_DESC_5021040.ContentEN: The most beloved aquatic creature on Purgatorio Island, with no recorded counterpart elsewhere. Plainly inedible, these fairy-like beings bring a spark of delight to islanders living far from the outside world, easing the monotony of their isolated days.

RESOURCE_DESC_5021050.ContentEN: A rare and exceptionally beautiful fish, its fins shimmer like the gleaming boughs of a Heaventree. On Purgatorio Island, it is revered as a gift from the divine — and when caught, it is often returned to the sea in quiet reverence.

RESOURCE_DESC_5022010.ContentEN: A speciality of the Huaxu Waters, often dubbed the "bat of the sea" by locals. It typically dwells near the seabed, surfacing only to feed. Its back is studded with pearlescent bumps — a texture prized for wrapping the hilts of fine weapons.

RESOURCE_DESC_5022020.ContentEN: A crab that makes its home inside abandoned clockwork parts. Though biologically little different from ordinary hermit crabs, the collapse of the Jishu Sect left behind scattered mechanical relics — now repurposed by these creatures as shelters across the seas.

RESOURCE_DESC_5022030.ContentEN: A mysterious aquatic lifeform recorded in ancient texts, said to spit venomous sand at the shadows of passers-by, afflicting them with strange illnesses.

RESOURCE_DESC_5022040.ContentEN: A fiercely aggressive species prized for its tender, flavourful meat — a familiar sight on dining tables across Huaxu. Despite its hideous appearance, the bioluminescent lure atop its head lends it a strangely delicate beauty.

RESOURCE_DESC_5022050.ContentEN: Named after the once-popular twin-bun hairstyle of Huaxu, this swift and ferocious predator is an opportunistic feeder, known for tearing through nets with ease — a true challenge for even seasoned fishers.

RESOURCE_DESC_5023010.ContentEN: A fish bearing a striking resemblance to Phoxene, with an uncanny texture that feels almost indistinguishable from the real thing. No two look quite the same — but they all share one unfortunate trait: flesh as tough as stone. It's rarely eaten except in times of true desperation.

RESOURCE_DESC_5023020.ContentEN: A brilliantly coloured fish that glides through the water like a wisp of silk. Its translucent fins ripple around it like trailing veils, and every motion flows with effortless poise — graceful as the fabled Lady of the Lake, wandering her liquid realm in quiet command.

RESOURCE_DESC_5023030.ContentEN: One of the staple food fish in Icelake, easily recognised by the single horn atop its head. Large, tender, and low in bones, it suits sashimi, grilling, frying, or baking — a truly versatile catch for any dish.

RESOURCE_DESC_5023040.ContentEN: A rare, cold-hardy fish found only in Icelake. With a tough, ridged carapace and no dorsal or ventral fins, it is easy to grip, much like the wooden clubs once used to pound laundry clean.

RESOURCE_DESC_5023050.ContentEN: A species unique to the waters of Icelake. Jagged, ice-like spines line its back, glowing faintly in the dark. On clear days, a streak of pale light beneath the surface often signals the silent passing of a Gleamspine.

RESOURCE_DESC_5024010.ContentEN: A vibrant, frilled fish prized for its looks. The fuller the fins, the brighter the colours, the higher the price. Fiercely territorial toward its own kind, each must be housed alone.

RESOURCE_DESC_5024020.ContentEN: A small squid named after Shouxing, the god of longevity in Huaxu myth. Though diminutive, its tentacles allow it to spring through the air with startling force. In Huaxu, it is a cherished symbol of long life — on elders' birthdays, desserts shaped in its likeness are a must-have at the celebration.

RESOURCE_DESC_5024030.ContentEN: Covered in fine barbs, this fish puffs into a spiny sphere when threatened, inflating itself with air or water. Despite being dangerously toxic and notoriously difficult to prepare, it remains a sought-after delicacy in Huaxu.

RESOURCE_DESC_5024040.ContentEN: A brightly coloured fish native to Huaxu, known for its pouch-like belly and bottom-dwelling habits. Though modest in size, it's prized for its tender, boneless meat — a favourite at many local restaurants.

RESOURCE_DESC_5024050.ContentEN:
A rare Huaxu fish that can grow up to four metres long. With a pointed snout and four pairs of ventral fins, it bears symmetrical markings and shimmering scales reminiscent of the Argent Dragon.
Though not protected under the Nine Chapters of Dafeng, the Waterwyrm is rarely hunted. Its likeness to the Argent Dragon stirs reverence across Huaxu — and few would risk sacrilege by putting it on a dinner table.

RESOURCE_DESC_5025010.ContentEN: A whiskered, long-tailed fish that favours cracks and corners, and is hardy enough to thrive even in stagnant or polluted waters. Unlike real rats, it doesn't gnaw on clothing or steal food — which is why children in the slums often keep them as low-maintenance pets.

RESOURCE_DESC_5025020.ContentEN: A smooth-skinned, scaleless creature with a tubular mouth lined with rows of sharp teeth — no upper or lower jaw. It burrows in sewer sludge and latches onto anything that gets too close... and once it does, it never lets go. Among sewer workers, it's considered the nastiest creature you can run into down there.

RESOURCE_DESC_5025030.ContentEN: A fully transparent fish with fine, delicate bones. Nearly impossible to spot with the naked eye, its flesh is gelatinous and inedible — though researchers believe it may be refined into a rare, highly specialised gel.

RESOURCE_DESC_5025040.ContentEN: A bizarre, limbed fish that lurks in the mud and occasionally emits blood-curdling cries. Its resemblance to the Filthoid is uncanny — though whether this is mere coincidence or something more remains unknown.

RESOURCE_DESC_5025050.ContentEN: A brownish fish with six twitching fins along its sides. Its jerky movements ripple through the water — unsettling to watch, but alarmingly fast. Two antenna-like feelers jut from its head, often the first sign it's lurking nearby. Ruthless and persistent, it's even been known to pursue prey onto dry land.

RESOURCE_DESC_5110100.ContentEN: A fishing rod crafted by Lunosmith, featuring a surface monitor styled after Cinder, her trusty little assistant. When a fish bites, Cinder lights up to signal it — though according to customer feedback, some folks got so mesmerised watching it glow, they ended up going home with an empty bucket.

RESOURCE_DESC_5110200.ContentEN: A fishing rod crafted by Lunosmith, featuring a surface monitor styled after Cinder, her trusty little assistant. When a fish bites, Cinder lights up to signal it — though according to customer feedback, some folks got so mesmerised watching it glow, they ended up going home with an empty bucket.

RESOURCE_DESC_5110300.ContentEN: A fishing rod crafted by Lunosmith, featuring a surface monitor styled after Cinder, her trusty little assistant. When a fish bites, Cinder lights up to signal it — though according to customer feedback, some folks got so mesmerised watching it glow, they ended up going home with an empty bucket.

RESOURCE_DESC_5110400.ContentEN: A fishing rod crafted by Lunosmith, featuring a surface monitor styled after Cinder, her trusty little assistant. When a fish bites, Cinder lights up to signal it — though according to customer feedback, some folks got so mesmerised watching it glow, they ended up going home with an empty bucket.

RESOURCE_DESC_5110500.ContentEN: A fishing rod crafted by Lunosmith, featuring a surface monitor styled after Cinder, her trusty little assistant. When a fish bites, Cinder lights up to signal it — though according to customer feedback, some folks got so mesmerised watching it glow, they ended up going home with an empty bucket.

RESOURCE_DESC_5210100.ContentEN: A standard lure meant to attract a fish's attention — whether it actually helps you catch anything... is another matter entirely.

RESOURCE_DESC_5210200.ContentEN: A special lure that shortens bite time. Maybe it's the way it wriggles — irresistible to most underwater dwellers.

RESOURCE_DESC_5210300.ContentEN: A formulated bait that boosts your odds of luring fish variants. To a creature with eccentric tastes, maybe a glinting hunk of scrap can pass for fine cuisine.

RESOURCE_DESC_5210400.ContentEN: A deceptively plain-looking lure, crafted from top-grade ingredients. Even the pickiest of fish keep pecking until the very last crumb is gone.

RESOURCE_DESC_6000001.ContentEN: A trade voucher issued by EverSpring, Zhiliu's guild.

RESOURCE_DESC_99.ContentEN:
A crystal harvested from a Heaventree — one of the most widely used minerals across Atlasia.
It emits a gentle glow, reminiscent of a full moon's radiance.

RESOURCE_DESC_CANCELPHANTOM.ContentEN:
A sigil for retracting a summoning. 
Although the gathering is brief, the longing does not cease, and perhaps the next reunion is just a blink away.

RESOURCE_DESC_GENERALSKIN_1.ContentEN: Grants a character from: Berenica, Phantasio, Lisbell, Lady Nifle, Fina, Rebecca, Tabethe, Lynn, Yale and Oliver, Hellfire, Margie, Rhythm, Randy, Sibylle, Truffle and Filbert, Outsider, Psyche, or Daphne.

RESOURCE_DESC_MUSIC.ContentEN: A piece of sheet music — its notes trace a story like footprints in the sand.

RESOURCE_DESC_PHANTOM.ContentEN:
A sigil for summoning Combat Partners. It is a staff to lean on in a battle, a pact of companionship, and an oath unspoken.
Heartfelt prayers shall be answered, and the desired one shall appear by your side.

RESOURCE_DESC_ROOT.ContentEN: Thoughts sifted from the drifting sands of remembrance. They carry the memory of someone — from the past, or from what is yet to come.

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_10018.ContentEN: Restores HP, can be equipped to your Tactical Backpack

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_10019.ContentEN: Restores Sanity, can be equipped to your Tactical Backpack

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_10020.ContentEN: Resupplies ammo, can be equipped to your Tactical Backpack

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_29001.ContentEN: Exchanges for exploration rewards from Lunoxplorer in Icelake.

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_29004.ContentEN: Redeemable for exploration rewards from the Lunoxplorer in Huaxu

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_30002.ContentEN: Used for crafting Weapon Track-Shift Modules

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_ACTION.ContentEN: A Posture, can be equipped to your Tactical Backpack

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_BATTLEPASSEXP.ContentEN: Used to complete Bard's Tome progress in exchange for Lirico's rewards

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_CHARPOL.ContentEN: Adjusts Character Demon Wedge Slot Track

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_DAILYGOALEXP.ContentEN: Used to claim daily rewards in Memo

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_DYE.ContentEN: Changes the colour of specific items

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_FISH_1.ContentEN: A saltwater fish. Can be traded for Angler's Tokens.

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_FISH_2.ContentEN: A freshwater fish. Can be traded for Angler's Tokens.

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_FISH_3.ContentEN: A fish caught in polluted waters. Can be traded for Angler's Tokens.

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_FORGING.ContentEN: Weapon component, used for forging weapons

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_INVITE.ContentEN: Unlocks Sojourns in Ripples of Talk

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_MUSIC.ContentEN: Use at the Sanctuary to play a track on the piano

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_PETCLAIM.ContentEN: Redeemable for a Geniemon from the Lore Compilation reward pool

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_ROOT.ContentEN: Unlock characters and raise their Intron Level through Reminiscence

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_ROUGECOIN.ContentEN: Redeemable for items at the Mystic Maze Shop

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_TIANFUCOIN.ContentEN: Lights up the blessings of the Lantern in Mystic Maze - Lantern Light-Up

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_WEAPONCARDLEVELUP.ContentEN: Used to raise a weapon's smelting level

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_WEAPONPOL.ContentEN: Adjusts Weapon Demon Wedge Slot Track

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_XIANSHIZHUIMI.ContentEN:
Allows one [Retrace].
Expires on 2025/7/2 17:00 (Automatically converts into Pristine Hourglasses upon expiry)

RESOURCE_FUNCTION_ZHUIMI.ContentEN: Grants one chance of Chrono Retrace.

RESOURCE_NAME_31006007.ContentEN: For What Dream Does Chrysalis Weave

RESOURCE_NAME_31006008.ContentEN: On What Breeze Do Wings Rise

RESOURCE_NAME_41005.ContentEN: Cat in a Box - Leaden Grey

RESOURCE_NAME_41006.ContentEN: Cat in a Box - White Sakura

RESOURCE_NAME_41016.ContentEN: Verses on the String – Opaque White

RESOURCE_TEXT_100.ContentEN:
"I'd say Phoxene is less currency, more 'bewitching stones' with an allure that no one can resist. In Atlasia, many have ventured through great trials and hardships, or even perished, all in the quest for these tiny rocks."

— Comnena, Chief Librarian of the Aethyrie Cloud Cavern Library, in "Betwixt Leaves and Branches—History of Atlasia"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10001.ContentEN:
"'A withered bough feels the gale, the ocean implies the chill.'
Hearken and behold, the path ahead whispers its secrets through every leaf and twig — all creation is a bearer of tidings."

— Yaoguang, Pioneer of the Huaxu Jishu Sect

RESOURCE_TEXT_10002.ContentEN:
"Humanity's relentless pursuit to grasp power has led to innumerable tragedies and yet, it has carved their place in history. Over the aeons, they've lit bonfires in wildlands, extracted ice from glaciers, sowed fields with crops, and corralled air currents in the winds. Thus, nature's elements gradually became tools at their disposal, easing their existence and embellishing their chronicles."

— Comnena, Chief Librarian of the Aethyrie Cloud Cavern Library, in "Betwixt Leaves and Branches—History of Atlasia"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10003.ContentEN:
"With delicate flutters, an Oceanifly can reach Luca's shores. The gentle air currents underneath the wings lift nothing heavier, but as they start to roam, what then? They might vanish, or perhaps grow stronger, traversing oceans and lands, evolving into a sweeping sandstorm across the realm of Khemet."

— Miller, Aethyrie scholar

RESOURCE_TEXT_10004.ContentEN:
In Huaxu's nascent years, ill portents befell the heavens. Venus shone by day; stars plummeted into the boundless deep. Across the wilds, Filthoids ran rampant as the Defilement spread.

Yang, traversing the realm his great hunt to make, smote the beast Chisel-Tooth within the Cursed Waters and did capture the Great Swine amidst the Mulberry Groves. Unto his vassals he bestowed arrows, commanding his lords to hunt nineteen great beasts, subduing all beneath heaven. Thus did all yield, proclaiming Yang their sovereign.

— Ban Ye, the Grand Historiographer, in "The Annals of Huaxu"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10005.ContentEN:
"Its radiance is unmistakable, even a hundred meters away. This cloak, meticulously crafted from myriad Flame Lizard scales, stands as an undeniable work of art. Forged in Khemet's golden age, its fiery red hue, shimmering like living flames under the sun, captures the essence of this passionate land.
Years later, Queen Lamia donned it on the battlefield, unwavering amidst ceaseless gunfire and sorcery. The enduring standoff lasted days and nights, with no turning back nor retreat, leaving the fires to burn on to this day."

— "Refraction", designed by Fiama

RESOURCE_TEXT_10006.ContentEN:
"In Khemet, the newborn are bathed in the glow of flames; upon death, they're liberated from corporeal chains by fire. Life may fade with time, but the soul lives on within the fire for eternity."

— Seth, King of Khemet, in "A Proclamation to the People of Khemet"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10007.ContentEN:
"I'd warn you not to go any further. Inside are prisoners serving endless sentences, shackled with chains that have no locks nor keys — all caught by the warden herself, those troubled souls. That's right, even she can't melt those iron clamps. Nowhere to run, no mercy to spare, that's our warden."

— A seasoned jailer's warning to a newcomer

RESOURCE_TEXT_10008.ContentEN:
"Wow! It's so incredibly beautiful! Look at that, an active volcano ready to blow any second! Pardon my bland comment, bet someone from the Symposium would've spun some fancier words. Wait, what's up with that dark cloud? Oh no, no, no, NOOOO!"

— An unnamed travel enthusiast

RESOURCE_TEXT_10009.ContentEN:
"Practicing art is like pearl diving: high pressure, little reward, always life-risking, and it drives you mad. In my class, I don't want toilet-paper essays or your trashy projects. Get your buns into the sea, find ordinary Pearl B, blue irregular Pearl A, and blue round Pearl S; return empty-handed and you fail! If you die in there, it's a fail too! Think it through before you take my class!"

—— Azura, Professor at Luca National Academy of Arts

RESOURCE_TEXT_1001.ContentEN:
"O The Spindle of fate!
That which thou weaveth 
Is grains of sand, a cord entwined in silicate— 
Alone it knows neither beginning nor end!"

—Excerpt from The Spindle of the Goddess of Fate, by an anonymous poet

RESOURCE_TEXT_10010.ContentEN:
"Perfume is the humectant of love. Whomever you're falling for, it keeps their love for you from withering...
I can see it from your eyes that you're in dire need of one right now, aren't you?"

— Rebecca, Perfumer of Luca

RESOURCE_TEXT_10011.ContentEN:
"The greatest invention of the Alchemy Academy; I use it as a cold-brew teapot. Mmm, it does give the tea a unique taste. Being able to enjoy tea of this quality on the battlefield, I am quite content!"

— Randy, Hyperborean Officer

RESOURCE_TEXT_10012.ContentEN:
"As summer arrives, I hear the glaciers melting, trickling, and dripping. I don't want to liken this sound to nature weeping — it's merely a fragment of the cycle. Nature is devoid of sentiment; it is I who want to weep, for I can never reach the other side of these mountains for life."

— Diary of a Watchtower Guard of the Askard Tribe

RESOURCE_TEXT_10013.ContentEN:
"Huaxu's buildings are mostly wooden, so they've mastered fire prevention. I once read some of their designs for mechanism arts: they hoped to add storage devices to lightning rods, aiming to turn 'natural electricity' into a new power source... Wonder if they succeeded."

— Dylan the Walking Encyclopedia, in "Into the Unseen Corners"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10014.ContentEN:
"In Huaxu's history, meteors were never symbols of luck or wish fulfillment. Instead, they called them 'Broom Stars', regarding them as omens of disaster and peril. Yet ironically, Huaxu became the earliest recorded nation to use meteorite products. It seems that when faced with practicality, the people of Huaxu were not opposed to overturning a few beliefs."

— Tacitus, Elysian Historian, in "Chronicles"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10015.ContentEN:
"O spindle of destiny,
With what does the merciless goddess weave thee?
Is it with the delicate threads of spiders from the abyss?
The golden fleece upon high peaks?
Or the subtle original sin coursing through our veins?!"

— Anonymous Poet, Excerpt from "The Spindle of the Goddess of Fate"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10016.ContentEN:
"No child could spurn a vial of captured lightning — its sparks that dance at your fingertips, like your very own genie in a bottle. In war-torn times, for many a child who has lost their family and friends, solace is found solely in this tiny bottle."

— Dylan the Walking Encyclopedia, in "Into the Unseen Corners"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10017.ContentEN:
"Not anyone could pull off these glasses — you either need to have deep-set eyes or strong eye muscles, I mean REALLY strong! From what I've seen, professors of the latter type usually have a short fuse — always either scowling like they're trying to squash a fly between their eyebrows or glaring at you with a squint. Trust me, no good can come from taking their classes."

— An Aethyrie Senior Who Prefers Anonymity

RESOURCE_TEXT_10018.ContentEN:
"Ugh, this thing's so heavy! Can't even lift my head properly!"

— Lisbell, candidate for "Patience" of the Seven Virtues of Elysium

RESOURCE_TEXT_10019.ContentEN:
"The first deity grants you life, to breathe and thrive on this land.
The second bestows a bounteous tide, enriching years ahead.
The third with wisdom's fire alight, to guide your soul through dark nights.
...
'Tis I who bring the final quest, to soothe your journey into rest."

— Extracted from the Elysian Scriptures, "Hymnal Vol. 1"

RESOURCE_TEXT_1002.ContentEN:
"What's this for, you say? Come here — Hoy! Get it? It's to spare me the bother of those annoying questions without drawing blood!"

— Lunosmith

RESOURCE_TEXT_10020.ContentEN:
"Beneath the sun's gaze, no shadow may lie.
In balance's scales, no bias resides.
Thy pleas acknowledged, thy sins to be tried.
A blade of dual edges, justice and retribution abide."

— Oath of the Elysian Judicial Ceremony

RESOURCE_TEXT_10021.ContentEN:
"The Empire's coming for a fight? Well, they'll get one! Not all Charons are willing to be their poodles! Ha, I'll chop them down, grab their fancy weapons, and make a mountain out of their corpses — right where we always do!"

— An Askard Tribesperson

RESOURCE_TEXT_10022.ContentEN:
"The realm of knowledge shows no favouritism, opening its doors equally to Solas and Charons. Just shed the heavy shackles and roam freely in pursuit of enlightenment. Bear in mind, even in the darkest of nights, our thoughts glow with undimmed light."

— Professor Montpelier, Arcadia Academy of Aethyrie

RESOURCE_TEXT_10023.ContentEN:
"The full moon weeps despair,
The abyss cradles lunacy.
The gods' domain lies in the unilluminated side,
While feeble fakes mire in a futile dither."

— Tome of The Selenism Ritual, Heresy of Elysium, "Beyond the Moon's Veil - Chapter Ⅱ"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10024.ContentEN:
"Experiment Log No. ■■■, Code 740■■31■■■, now commencing. Coolant engaged, safety pin removed, pressure valve released. All personnel, recheck your protective gear — What in the world is that!!! Back off! NOW!! ■■ cells showing unidentifiable aberrations, taking on a radiant form■■■■, I can't ■■, request immediate■■■■■■■■■■■"

— Record of an experiment gone wrong

RESOURCE_TEXT_1003.ContentEN:
"O The Spindle of fate!
That which thou weaveth 
Is grains of sand, a cord entwined in silicate— 
Alone it knows neither beginning nor end!"

—Excerpt from The Spindle of the Goddess of Fate, by an anonymous poet

RESOURCE_TEXT_1006.ContentEN:
Don't fret, little one — it's only been melted down. With this mould at hand, this old smith'll have you a finer blade in no time. 
 — Lunosmith

RESOURCE_TEXT_101.ContentEN:
"One, two, three... three hundred and sixty! Behold, the Demon King's piggy bank of dreams. I now grant this to you — make sure it's put to good use!"

— Snow the "Demon King"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10100.ContentEN:
"Child, even though the path ahead is uncertain, always proceed with determination."

— Lady Nifle, Ferrywoman of the Misty Sea

RESOURCE_TEXT_10101.ContentEN:
"One day, I realised I could no longer cry. Perhaps it was the battlefield smoke clouding my eyes — or perhaps I had, at last, parted ways with the weakness in me."

— From the notes of a Hyperborean soldier

RESOURCE_TEXT_10102.ContentEN:
"Lamp on my helmet, pick in my grip — down the shaft we chase Phoxene's glint.
We sweat, we bleed, we strain our bones — so we'll get rich with these stones!"

— Miner's folk rhyme, Icelake

RESOURCE_TEXT_10104.ContentEN:
"Sure, we've all got our brand of justice. And justice always arrives late. So today, right here — let my blade call the shots. Sound good?"

— Kezhou, Swordsman of Huaxu

RESOURCE_TEXT_1011101.ContentEN:
"Our tale spans over two millennia: a saga of embrace and massacre, of furore and mercy. History ebbs and flows like the celestial dance of the sun and the moon – constant and cyclical. In the grand tapestry of time recounted in these pages, I am but a mere observer, as insignificant as a flake of Hyperborean snow, a leaf from Aethyrie, a drop in Luca's waters, or a grain from Khemet's sands. Yet, in this immense cosmos, I harbour the hope that snowflakes will forge snowfields, leaves will form forests, drops of water will coalesce into rivers, and grains will gather to sculpt deserts. As all singular entities unite, history shall pivot in our favour."

— Betwixt Leaves And Branches — History of Atlasia, by Comnena, Chief Librarian of the Aethyrie Cloud Cavern Library

RESOURCE_TEXT_102.ContentEN:
"Spirits of kindred align, resonating as one. 
In crimson deep, awaken powers asleep."

— Inscription from an unearthed tablet in the Askard Fjord

RESOURCE_TEXT_10200.ContentEN:
"We require no medals, for loyalty itself is the finest commendation."

— A Veteran from The 1st Legion of Hyperborean Empire

RESOURCE_TEXT_10201.ContentEN:
"We require no medals, for loyalty itself is the finest commendation."

— A Veteran from The 1st Legion of Hyperborean Empire

RESOURCE_TEXT_10202.ContentEN:
"We require no medals, for loyalty itself is the finest commendation."

— A Veteran from The 1st Legion of Hyperborean Empire

RESOURCE_TEXT_10206.ContentEN:
"Biru, with its verdant hue and astringent taste, offers a subtle aftertaste of sweetness a moment after consumption. Taken in proper amounts, it can calm the mind and soothe the spirit, as well as nourish wounds. However, improper dosage carries the risk of causing numbness."

— Fufeng, Huaxu Apothecary, in "Essentials of Medicinal Herbs"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10207.ContentEN:
"Biru, with its verdant hue and astringent taste, offers a subtle aftertaste of sweetness a moment after consumption. Taken in proper amounts, it can calm the mind and soothe the spirit, as well as nourish wounds. However, improper dosage carries the risk of causing numbness."

— Fufeng, Huaxu Apothecary, in "Essentials of Medicinal Herbs"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10208.ContentEN:
"Biru, with its verdant hue and astringent taste, offers a subtle aftertaste of sweetness a moment after consumption. Taken in proper amounts, it can calm the mind and soothe the spirit, as well as nourish wounds. However, improper dosage carries the risk of causing numbness."

— Fufeng, Huaxu Apothecary, in "Essentials of Medicinal Herbs"

RESOURCE_TEXT_10209.ContentEN:
"True that we excel at archery, but making it the focus of a coming-of-age ceremony? It's purely biased."

— An Askard Tribesperson

RESOURCE_TEXT_10210.ContentEN:
"True that we excel at archery, but making it the focus of a coming-of-age ceremony? It's purely biased."

— An Askard Tribesperson

RESOURCE_TEXT_10211.ContentEN:
"True that we excel at archery, but making it the focus of a coming-of-age ceremony? It's purely biased."

— An Askard Tribesperson

RESOURCE_TEXT_103.ContentEN:
"While focused dedication is admirable, it's all about balance and moderation. Overexertion leading to frailty and weariness is a folly to be avoided."

— Fushu, Huaxu Apothecary

RESOURCE_TEXT_105.ContentEN: A priceless gift for participants of the Second Closed Beta Test.

RESOURCE_TEXT_110.ContentEN:
"This is the 'Rainbow.' It's right there in your palm, hidden inside this small, glittering tube. Turn it, and you can see forests, constellations, snow stretching like an endless desert... Berry, {nickname}, even if we have to stay hidden in these ruins for now, I still want you both to see a world far more vast and wondrous."

— ???

RESOURCE_TEXT_11001.ContentEN:
"He is advancing,
He is advancing!
I hear his thunderous steps resound,
I hear the Sword of Torrent scrape on the ground!
He shall claim the lives of the unjust,
No one here can escape the tempest!
None can resist death's looming tonight,
Nor wrest the sword from his grasp so tight!"

— Excerpt from Le Rhapsodie de Torrent, by Alexandre Thomas, a mourning faction playwright

RESOURCE_TEXT_11002.ContentEN:
"He is advancing,
He is advancing!
I hear his thunderous steps resound,
I hear the Sword of Torrent scrape on the ground!
He shall claim the lives of the unjust,
No one here can escape the tempest!

Nor wrest the sword from his grasp so tight!"

RESOURCE_TEXT_11004.ContentEN:
"The essence of swordsmanship lies in the unity of the wielder's spirit. With utmost focus, one can cleave through the mightiest foes, be they ocean waves or leviathans."

— Excerpt from The Art of the Sword, by a nameless swordsman from Huaxu

RESOURCE_TEXT_11005.ContentEN:
"The essence of swordsmanship lies in the unity of the wielder's spirit. With utmost focus, one can cleave through the mightiest foes, be they ocean waves or leviathans."

— Excerpt from The Art of the Sword, by a nameless swordsman from Huaxu

— Excerpt from The Art of the Sword, by a nameless swordsman from Huaxu

RESOURCE_TEXT_11007.ContentEN:
"What's so bad about being different? People are always bending over backwards trying to prove how unique they are. Me? Ha, I was born an outcast, a natural oddity shunned by Father Ask, the most bizarre ornament in the tribe!"

— "The Raven" Chaos, from The Forsakens

RESOURCE_TEXT_11008.ContentEN:
"What's so bad about being different? People are always bending over backwards trying to prove how unique they are. Me? Ha, I was born an outcast, a natural oddity shunned by Father Ask, the most bizarre ornament in the tribe!"

— "The Raven" Chaos, from The Forsakens

RESOURCE_TEXT_11009.ContentEN:
"What's so bad about being different? People are always bending over backwards trying to prove how unique they are. Me? Ha, I was born an outcast, a natural oddity shunned by Father Ask, the most bizarre ornament in the tribe!"

— "The Raven" Chaos, from The Forsakens

RESOURCE_TEXT_11010.ContentEN:
"I know everyone here likes to think of themselves as artists, but seriously, you're all a bunch of morons. What you do is simply alchemy, medicine, or drawing. What's the point of obsessing over the meaning of life or the consequences of your work? Check out this new gun I made — awesome, right?"

— Nisaya, Weapon Master of The Aeolipile

RESOURCE_TEXT_11011.ContentEN:
"I know everyone here likes to think of themselves as artists, but seriously, you're all a bunch of morons. What you do is simply alchemy, medicine, or drawing. What's the point of obsessing over the meaning of life or the consequences of your work? Check out this new gun I made — awesome, right?"

— Nisaya, Weapon Master of The Aeolipile

RESOURCE_TEXT_11012.ContentEN:

— Nisaya, Weapon Master of The Aeolipile

RESOURCE_TEXT_11013.ContentEN:
"The trigger is the most crucial part of any mechanical device. Even from a developer's perspective, I can tell you — no matter how intricate the internal workings are, it's just a piece of scrap if the trigger doesn't function properly. Trust me, I speak from experience — if my trigger had jammed back then, I wouldn't be here today."

— An unnamed veteran traveller

RESOURCE_TEXT_11014.ContentEN:
"The trigger is the most crucial part of any mechanical device. Even from a developer's perspective, I can tell you — no matter how intricate the internal workings are, it's just a piece of scrap if the trigger doesn't function properly. Trust me, I speak from experience — if my trigger had jammed back then, I wouldn't be here today."

Trust me, I speak from experience — if my trigger had jammed back then, I wouldn't be here today."

RESOURCE_TEXT_11016.ContentEN:
"Sure, the legion gives us some freedom to customise our weapons, but painting my gun pink? That's where I draw the line! I don't care if you're my sister, that's still a no. And take that teddy bear charm off!"

— Lynn, an officer of the Hyperborean Legion

RESOURCE_TEXT_11017.ContentEN:
"Sure, the legion gives us some freedom to customise our weapons, but painting my gun pink? That's where I draw the line! I don't care if you're my sister, that's still a no. And take that teddy bear charm off!"

— Lynn, an officer of the Hyperborean Legion

RESOURCE_TEXT_121.ContentEN:
"Mmm... Order confirmed. Be sure to drop by for your daily Phoxene... Yaaawn... Now, back to my nap... Zzzzz..."

 — Lunotress

RESOURCE_TEXT_122.ContentEN:
"Mmm... Order confirmed. Be sure to drop by for your daily Phoxene... Yaaawn... Now, back to my nap... Zzzzz..." 

— Lunotress

RESOURCE_TEXT_19000.ContentEN: To guard memory from time's reach, we tuck it gently into cherished items. And when these resurface, the Soulprints sealed within stir... and bloom before our eyes.

RESOURCE_TEXT_19001.ContentEN: To guard memory from time's reach, we tuck it gently into cherished items. And when these resurface, the Soulprints sealed within stir... and bloom before our eyes.
