RESOURCE_TEXT_20001.ContentEN:
"Those Filthoids have shells as tough as iron! You'd need a blade sharper and harder than steel to hunt 'em down."

— Lunosmith

RESOURCE_TEXT_20002.ContentEN:
"The rain was relentless, pelting down. I rummaged through my pockets, holding up glass jar after jar to her nose, but she never again woke up to stroke my head with a smile. I know she's gone to a far, far better place than here."

— Fina, Citizen of Icelake

RESOURCE_TEXT_20003.ContentEN:
"In time's flowing river, we meet and part, enfolded in 'Her' embrace to the journey's end, returning to life's very heart."

— Tal, Unofficial Preacher of Elysian Church

RESOURCE_TEXT_20004.ContentEN:
"To some soldiers, a medal of honour holds more weight than life itself. Too bad that I'm not cut from that noble cloth."

— Randy, Hyperborean Officer

RESOURCE_TEXT_20005.ContentEN:
"Blinded, the stones began to whisper to me... their murmurs guiding my chisel, crafting shapes they yearned to become."

— Vina, Elysian Sculptor

RESOURCE_TEXT_20006.ContentEN:
"The Holy Iris Knights, Elysium's devout defenders, clad in shining armours, battling for thy faith. In this grand crusade, blessed by His hand, with Him at thy side, invincible thou shalt stand."

— Eilon, 132nd Commander of the Holy Iris Knights, "Pre-Battle Speech"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20007.ContentEN:
"Hey, kid, fancy a firework show? Follow this genius's lead — spark up that wire, and I promise, you'll see the grandest fireworks ever!"

— Oliver the Bomb Expert

RESOURCE_TEXT_20008.ContentEN:
"Humanity's tale is one of combat with Filthoids. For fifteen centuries, we've but 'driven them away', never truly vanquished them... for true understanding had always eluded us... Now, the tide turns. The Repulsive Crystal's unveiling, I believe, marks our first stride towards a true 'triumph' over them."

— Timbergen, Pioneer of Filthology at Spathatoi, in "History of Filthoids: From the High Tower to the Mosken Sea"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20009.ContentEN:
"Through wilderness, thorns pierce his bare feet;
Still, his haste unceased.
In search for the lost beloved,
Until his arms, aloft, turn to towering peaks,
His blood and tears bloom into crimson wreaths."

— Lirico, Wandering Bard, in "Tales of the Misty Sea"

RESOURCE_TEXT_2001.ContentEN:
"Go to them, find solace amongst the banished souls.
Endure the twilight's cleansing, navigate through the boundless gloom,
Together, towards the dawn of a new day."
— ???

RESOURCE_TEXT_20010.ContentEN:
"Also known as the Ashless Wood, dark in colour, with leaves white as bone; resembling rotten timber, yet flame shuns its touch.
Its bark is edible, with an astringent and cold taste, non-toxic.
Can soothe swollen throats and quell inner heat, taken twice daily in a brew."

— Fufeng, Huaxu Apothecary, in "Essentials of Medicinal Herbs"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20011.ContentEN:
"How come the villains in stories never cry? Is it because their tears are too thick, like jelly? Or is it because their hearts are so cold that their tears are frozen for eternity?"

— Fina, Citizen of Icelake

RESOURCE_TEXT_20012.ContentEN:
"The Elysian Church seemed ready for war, with legions of knights silently invoking the divine name, marching towards the borders in shimmering silver chainmail and golden helms. As they gathered, the vast plains glittered like a lake of gold and silver. Many swore, in that day's sunlight, they glimpsed the divine shadow leading Elysium to triumph."

— Tacitus, Elysian Historian, in "Chronicles"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20013.ContentEN:
"Luno Coins are really valuable! And these are a token of our friendship, so you better take good care of them!"

— Snow the "Demon King"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20014.ContentEN:
"When the spring breeze sweeps across the snowy plains and brushes through the branches, the birds adorn themselves with airy new feathers, leaving their old winter plumage behind for those who pour their thoughts onto paper... It is with these less delicate feathers that Fina's dreams soar high."
 
 — Fina, a resident of Icelake

RESOURCE_TEXT_20015.ContentEN:
"Heavy they might be, they must be carried at all times. More than a mere legion order, it's a safeguard. I wish for you all to return home unscathed."

— Rhythm, Soldier of Icelake Escort

RESOURCE_TEXT_20016.ContentEN:
"O Lord of Life and Bounty! May Your boon be everlasting upon me, let Elysium always bask in Your guardianship, our pure hearts forever in Your embrace."

— The Elysian Church Prayer

RESOURCE_TEXT_20017.ContentEN:
"The blizzards of the north are devastating to both soul and shoddy homes. Winter's toll ran high until the Aeolipile devised 'iron rooftops'. Merely crude, hefty iron plates, yet they averted snow's deadly weight — from that year on, there were almost no deaths from snow. This technique was later adapted for military use; though, rumour has it, the military still hasn't paid them for the patent."

— Dylan the Walking Encyclopedia, in "Into the Unseen Corners"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20018.ContentEN:
"Thy spring of youth hath waned, ne'er to renew."

"Yet, 'tis not a cause to sheathe the blade."

"Thy light of wisdom hath dimmed, ne'er to relume."

"Yet, 'tis not a cause to mute the words."

"Thy path to return doth end, ne'er to tread anew."

"Yet, 'tis not a cause to halt the advance."

"O valiant soul bereft of might, mind, and home! The hero with nothing left to offer for war! Heed Destiny's inquiry — what dost thy heart yearn? Whither dost thy blade drive?"

— Anonymous Poet, Excerpt from "The Spindle of the Goddess of Fate"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20019.ContentEN:
"It burns fiercer than the most dangerous flame of love!"

— Rebecca, Perfumer of Luca

RESOURCE_TEXT_2002.ContentEN: Transcribed and adapted by Lirico, these lines ride the wind and falling leaves, echoing through the skies of Atlasia — sung by bards, shaped by your every step.

RESOURCE_TEXT_20020.ContentEN:
"No, Filbert! I know they smell good, but they'll give you ouchies in your tummy! Come on, let's go find some yummy berries and mushrooms for you, okay?"

— Truffle, Commissary of Elysium

RESOURCE_TEXT_20021.ContentEN:
"Under the argent moon's glow, we kneel to light the sacred candles,
Hailing the Weaver of Fate's thread.
May the sacred flame never be extinguished,
As its radiance endures eternal."

— The Elysian Church Prayer

RESOURCE_TEXT_20022.ContentEN:
"It reminds me of the flow of time... Like time, it heals fractures, veils the past, feigns that all is well. Indeed, its true intent was to reinforce crumbling old structures. But everything has its limits; under intense heat, it violently explodes, erasing all, be it old or new."

— Emerald, Aeolipile Material Scientist, in "Principles and Instructions for Use of New Materials"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20023.ContentEN:
"Here I lay in eternal repose,
Beneath countless sand grains,
With no opulent sepulchre,
But at dawn's light,
My golden grave gleams bright."

— "The Gold Miners' Evening Bell", a Khemet ballad

RESOURCE_TEXT_20024.ContentEN:
"Don't cut it in front of me! I can't watch this... aaaaaaaargh!"

— Demon Tabethe the Red Hand

RESOURCE_TEXT_20025.ContentEN:
"Some boxes are to be opened, others not — thought that was common sense. If it's a holiday gift from Mom, go ahead, rip it open; but if it's a box made of fine iron, glowing eerily from the inside, with a big warning sign saying DANGER on it, you'd better chuck it into a ditch right away. But no one listened to me, so now I'm the only one left sitting here. *sigh*"

— Testimony taken after an accident

RESOURCE_TEXT_20026.ContentEN:
Once you've familiarised yourself with the info, you might get rid of the used pages and repurpose the rest as a regular notebook.

" 12 05 01 22 05 20 08 05 02 01 19 05
04 05 19 20 18 15 25 20 08 05 06 09 12 05 19
01 14 04 05 22 01 03 21 01 20 05 14 15 23"

— A piece of simple code left on a notebook

RESOURCE_TEXT_20027.ContentEN:
"Beside me descends the scythe-bearing deity,
Forbidding retreat, hesitation, or doubt.
I shall be the extension of its blade,
I shall be the embodiment of its will, 
I shall slay without mercy,
Till all foes rest under its wings named Death."

— Extracted from the Elysian Scriptures, "Hymnal Vol. 2"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20028.ContentEN:
"Its design was inspired by hunting — my family used to be hunters, and we had to cater to various needs of clients. If the prey's size was all that mattered, sheer firepower could do the trick; for fur preservation, the bullet's impact had to be internal, minimising external damage; as for pets, the wounds needed to be treatable — a real challenge! At first, I just wanted to make Dad's life easier, with no plan to create anything big. Sadly, these bullets ended up on the battlefield, and not even a shell found its way back to him."

— Nisaea, Aeolipile Master Gunsmith, in casual conversation at a secret tea party, recorded in "Gatherings Under the Night-Blooming Jasmine"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20029.ContentEN:
"Few know that the Gad Weaponholder was the first patented invention. When the patent system was first introduced, no one was willing to risk their trade secrets; while the Gad Weaponholder is simple in technology, so it was put forward to test the waters. Of course, it ended up being a tremendous success. Ol' Gad could have made a fortune from this patent, but, 'I've made a mere holder ace all my life. I'm just glad you all like it. Go ahead, use it as you wish, for free!' said he. Quite touching, isn't it?"

— Dylan the Walking Encyclopedia, in "Into the Unseen Corners"

RESOURCE_TEXT_2003.ContentEN: From grand quests to the simplest errands, each mark brings you closer to your goal — proof that no effort goes unnoticed.

RESOURCE_TEXT_20030.ContentEN:
"Even among us nerds, she's the weird one. I thought the comment about us holding research as dear as life was only metaphorical, yet to her, it was for real. Why do you think she'd put rust inhibitor in a syringe? Because 'the apparatuses are living things, and the rust inhibitor is their serum; what else would I use for injection but a syringe?' I mean, wow..."

— Anonymous Alchemist, in casual conversation at a secret tea party, recorded in "Gatherings Under the Night-Blooming Jasmine"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20031.ContentEN:
"When humans suffer heavy blows, muscles and fat provide cushioning. Similarly, if materials react too violently to the point of mutual annihilation, structures similar to Filthoid tissues can slow down the process; I suppose this is a way of recycling. Perhaps we should erect a monument for these creatures who sacrificed themselves for the alchemical cause."

— Ecodna, Chief of Biological Applications at The Spathatoi, in "Disassembly and Reassembly: Biology of Filthoids"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20032.ContentEN:
"Take me to see the glacial blues of the North,
Beneath the grey canopy of sky,
Where a vast ocean of stern, metallic hues lies."

— Lirico, the Wandering Bard, in "Tales of the Misty Sea"

RESOURCE_TEXT_20033.ContentEN:
"Child, do not revel in companionship nor weep at parting, for we are but fleeting moments in time."

— Lady Nifle, Ferrywoman of the Misty Sea

RESOURCE_TEXT_2004.ContentEN: Transcribed and adapted by Lirico, these lines ride the wind and falling leaves, echoing through the skies of Atlasia — sung by bards, shaped by your every step.

RESOURCE_TEXT_2007.ContentEN:
"Fiery sparks lash against your cheeks, while the clang of steel tears through your ears.
Should your heart tremble for it, should your blood surge for it,
Then step forth, and wield your blade,
Embrace the fate of battle, until there is no turning back."

— Anonymous, on the title page of "The Art of Combat"

RESOURCE_TEXT_201.ContentEN:
"Mastering the art of using tools on the right occasions isn't laziness. In fact, it's a vital tactic for wrapping up battles efficiently. As for the time saved, it's naturally meant for relaxing one's weary body and mind with a well-deserved sleep..."

— Randy, Hyperborean Officer

RESOURCE_TEXT_2011.ContentEN:
"I'm with Sander on this. In the earliest renditions, Euaron bore no malevolence. She was a singer in the realm of duality. Her voice, like the breeze soothing the warriors' souls, bestowed them with the courage for battle. It's clear that across a dozen later versions, Euaron's enchanting voice remains her hallmark." — Mayya

"The concept of the realm of duality and Euaron's root are utterly disconnected, with no linguistic theories to support such a claim. This is clearly a far-fetched association." — Torina

"What are you arguing about? It's all gibberish to me." — Rees


"Oi! Quit yapping utter tripe that just fills the air!" — Mitty

RESOURCE_TEXT_202.ContentEN:
"Of course, weapons have their own temperaments! If she's upset, it throws me off in combat... It's only natural to feel this way, as we are the closest comrades and partners! Am I right, Samael?"

— Lisbell, candidate for "Patience" of the Seven Virtues of Elysium

RESOURCE_TEXT_203.ContentEN:
"I beg of you... please don't take my final gleam of light..."

—A twisted figure in the abyss

RESOURCE_TEXT_204.ContentEN:
"Like tea and coffee, it's just another way to squeeze out more energy and keep going. But honestly, the only real cure for exhaustion is proper rest, so if you're tired, go get some sleep... zZZ..."

— Lunotress

RESOURCE_TEXT_205.ContentEN:
"I can no longer move, so please, take my lantern. Carry me, carry us all, and spread the divine light... into every corner of the abyss..."

—Last words of a Pioneer Knight

RESOURCE_TEXT_206.ContentEN:
"Let's see, today's commissions include... finding a lost wallet, saving a stray cat on the roof, and mending a broken heart?? Handling all these trivial jobs one by one is a real hassle. I'll just bundle them together and finish them in one go."

— Outsider, a Phoxhunter

RESOURCE_TEXT_210.ContentEN:
Take it. Consider it your graduation gift. Don't underestimate this little coin — I've spent a lifetime chasing fish that couldn't stand the sight of me. This coin... is all I have left to give.

— A veteran angler clutching a coin, reluctant to let go

RESOURCE_TEXT_211.ContentEN:
"Gold buried deep must be drawn with bare hands.
Jewels under the currents only gleam for keen eyes.
So too the Phoxhunters' treasure —
They lie hidden between the words, in full measure."

— Percy Ballard, wandering bard, Song of the Phoxhunters

RESOURCE_TEXT_215.ContentEN:
"I shall prove to the world that talent and genius can be reforged by the hand of an alchemist."

— Chief Alchemist Flamel

RESOURCE_TEXT_29001.ContentEN:
An island beyond divine gaze and imperial reach. A place where seabirds wheel above crumbled colonnades, and memories lie buried beneath moss and the slow tides of time.
Venture forth — to witness, to listen, to explore the land called Purgatorio Island, where secrets linger and echoes of the past still stir.

RESOURCE_TEXT_29002.ContentEN:
This is Icelake.
Before others define it for you, knock on every door. Search every hidden corner. Speak to every soul. And in time, you'll see the city changing — quietly, subtly — because of you. No introductions are needed. Icelake is you, and you it.
Step beyond — to witness, to listen, to become one with a city still waiting to be known.

RESOURCE_TEXT_29003.ContentEN:
A fortress unmoved by rivers of iron or storms of steel. Only laments now cross its ramparts — but no wall is truly unbreachable. The strongest bastions fall not to force, but to what stirs unseen within the heart.
Go deeper into the Fortress — to witness, to listen, where smoke still hangs and memory refuses to fade.

RESOURCE_TEXT_29004.ContentEN:
Where land and sea fall away — the first breath and final hush of every trade route.
 The incense-laced air hums with legend; beneath the eaves, whispers still drift. When the smoke lifts and dust settles... what will tomorrow hold?
 Go forth — to see, to listen — and explore Huaxu, a realm ready to leave its yesterdays behind.

RESOURCE_TEXT_30001.ContentEN:
"Purity cuts both ways: a single component enhances its potency but also accelerates its expiration. My task is simply to adjust the impurity ratio, seeking a balance between strength and eternity. In fact, this principle applies not only to alchemy but also to any groups."

— Ecodna, Chief of Biological Applications at The Spathatoi, in "Disassembly and Reassembly: Biology of Filthoids"

RESOURCE_TEXT_30002.ContentEN:
"How fascinating! These little parts might seem dull to you at the moment, but once the fuse is lit, they will roar in the most spectacular way!"

— Oliver, Bomb Expert

RESOURCE_TEXT_3001.ContentEN:
"Humans, as social creatures, are willing to pay unimaginable prices to alter others' perceptions of them, for better or worse. It might take effort, love, or just a little nudge from some big shot in the 'herd'."

— Camilla, Proprietor of The Asphodel in Icelake

RESOURCE_TEXT_3002.ContentEN:
"The secret recipe that every Geniemon craves: three parts fruit, two slices of choice meat, all topped off with a generous, never-expiring dollop of love." 

— A true Geniemon enthusiast

RESOURCE_TEXT_3003.ContentEN:
"The secret recipe that every Geniemon craves: three parts fruit, two slices of choice meat, all topped off with a generous, never-expiring dollop of love." 

— A true Geniemon enthusiast

RESOURCE_TEXT_3004.ContentEN:
"Dull coat? Low energy? Probably just a lack of proper nutrients. Here — try this little mix I made. Oh, don't get me wrong! I'm not saying you haven't been taking good care of your Geniemons!"
— A well-meaning Geniemon lover, trying to reassure a worried friend

RESOURCE_TEXT_3005.ContentEN:
"Dull coat? Low energy? Probably just a lack of proper nutrients. Here — try this little mix I made. Oh, don't get me wrong! I'm not saying you haven't been taking good care of your Geniemons!"
— A well-meaning Geniemon lover, trying to reassure a worried friend

RESOURCE_TEXT_3006.ContentEN:
"Dull coat? Low energy? Probably just a lack of proper nutrients. Here — try this little mix I made. Oh, don't get me wrong! I'm not saying you haven't been taking good care of your Geniemons!"
— A well-meaning Geniemon lover, trying to reassure a worried friend

RESOURCE_TEXT_3007.ContentEN:
"Mmm... smells so sweet and creamy... You think if I sneak a sip, I'll grow bigger and stronger?"
— A whimsical Geniemon lover, feeding his Geniemon a bottle of Yum-Yum Milk

RESOURCE_TEXT_3008.ContentEN:
"I never even knew it could do that. I don't know what it's made of, either. Maybe it hit me in a drunken haze... maybe I passed out mid-cuddle. Or maybe — just maybe — it's because I love my Geniemon friends that much."
 — A true Geniemon enthusiast

RESOURCE_TEXT_30101.ContentEN:
"The rubbish bins with little green flowers painted on them, near the west side of town — those are Leonie's. The ones by Glevum Pit, painted with grey stones are Edwin's. And those with the big yellow suns? All mine! But staring at the same colours gets boring after a while, so we switch things up now and then — that's the secret to keeping it fresh."

— Margie, Icelake Scavenger

RESOURCE_TEXT_30102.ContentEN:
"The rubbish bins with little green flowers painted on them, near the west side of town — those are Leonie's. The ones by Glevum Pit, painted with grey stones are Edwin's. And those with the big yellow suns? All mine! But staring at the same colours gets boring after a while, so we switch things up now and then — that's the secret to keeping it fresh."

— Margie, Icelake Scavenger

RESOURCE_TEXT_30103.ContentEN:
"The rubbish bins with little green flowers painted on them, near the west side of town — those are Leonie's. The ones by Glevum Pit, painted with grey stones are Edwin's. And those with the big yellow suns? All mine! But staring at the same colours gets boring after a while, so we switch things up now and then — that's the secret to keeping it fresh."

— Margie, Icelake Scavenger

RESOURCE_TEXT_30104.ContentEN:
"The rubbish bins with little green flowers painted on them, near the west side of town — those are Leonie's. The ones by Glevum Pit, painted with grey stones are Edwin's. And those with the big yellow suns? All mine! But staring at the same colours gets boring after a while, so we switch things up now and then — that's the secret to keeping it fresh."

— Margie, Icelake Scavenger

And those with the big yellow suns? All mine! But staring at the same colours gets boring after a while, so we switch things up now and then — that's the secret to keeping it fresh."

— Margie, Icelake Scavenger

And those with the big yellow suns? All mine! But staring at the same colours gets boring after a while, so we switch things up now and then — that's the secret to keeping it fresh."

— Margie, Icelake Scavenger

And those with the big yellow suns? All mine! But staring at the same colours gets boring after a while, so we switch things up now and then — that's the secret to keeping it fresh."

And those with the big yellow suns? All mine! But staring at the same colours gets boring after a while, so we switch things up now and then — that's the secret to keeping it fresh."

And those with the big yellow suns? All mine! But staring at the same colours gets boring after a while, so we switch things up now and then — that's the secret to keeping it fresh."

— Margie, Icelake Scavenger

RESOURCE_TEXT_30110.ContentEN:
"The rubbish bins with little green flowers painted on them, near the west side of town — those are Leonie's. The ones by Glevum Pit, painted with grey stones are Edwin's. And those with the big yellow suns? All mine! But staring at the same colours gets boring after a while, so we switch things up now and then — that's the secret to keeping it fresh."

—Margie, Icelake Scavenger

RESOURCE_TEXT_30111.ContentEN:
"The rubbish bins with little green flowers painted on them, near the west side of town — those are Leonie's. The ones by Glevum Pit, painted with grey stones are Edwin's. And those with the big yellow suns? All mine! But staring at the same colours gets boring after a while, so we switch things up now and then — that's the secret to keeping it fresh."

—Margie, Icelake Scavenger

RESOURCE_TEXT_40001.ContentEN:
"There were times, after I inadvertently had poisonous berries, tumbled down slopes, or fought fierce beasts, I thought I'd slip into sleep and never wake again. What woke me wasn't strong will, dreams, or even anyone's voice — it was merely instinct and a small vial of smelling salts."

— Outsider the Phoxhunter

RESOURCE_TEXT_40003.ContentEN:
"Bullets are the cruellest yet most merciful thing. They are the lips and teeth of the god of war, impartially kissing and nipping at every warm body. Be they monks or commoners, merchants or beggars, overlords or courtesans."

— Comnena, Chief Librarian of the Aethyrie Cloud Cavern Library, in "Betwixt Leaves and Branches—History of Atlasia"

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010001.ContentEN:
"If only spring at Icelake lasted longer. For most of the year, all we see is endless snow. On days when viriflies aren't around, evergreen plants are the closest thing we have to spring."

— Psyche, an Icelake resident

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010002.ContentEN:
"To think that butterflies can live in the snow — such a miraculous and beautiful form of life. Hidden within the buds of winter plants, they metamorphose and emerge when the flowers bloom, like ethereal blossoms."

— Miller, a botanist of Aethyrie

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010003.ContentEN:
"Shed the dust, the weariness, and the noise in your mind. Let it all wash away with the waters, and you'll come to truly know yourself."

— Tal, Unofficial Preacher of Elysian Church

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010004.ContentEN:
"A Filthoid and a snowman, boogie...boogie till the end..."

— A victim of Snowcap poisoning

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010005.ContentEN:
"Phoxichor may be common, but it is far from ordinary — it embodies the distilled genius of imperial alchemists across ages. Personally, I believe it should be reserved for only a select few, to truly underscore its significance."

— An Aeolipile alchemist specializing in material science research

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010006.ContentEN:
"Clad in royal purple and featuring intricate blue double petals and slender stem, this herb withstands harsh cold.
Direct consumption is cautioned against, as it can chill the heart and limbs.
Cook it at high heat to create a soothing, detoxifying decoction."

— Fufeng, Huaxu Apothecary, in "Essentials of Medicinal Herbs"

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010007.ContentEN:
"Shells were the only ornaments we could get back then. After the tide went out, we'd search for the prettiest ones to decorate our huts. I still remember the most beautiful one I found — smooth and pure white, shimmering like a rainbow in the sunlight..."

— A resident of Purgatorio Island

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010008.ContentEN:
"Please be cautious around unfamiliar wild plants and fungi. Avoid picking, buying, or selling species like Frostungus and Eclipta Grass, commonly known as 'Snowcap' and 'Bubble Bean.'"

— Rhythm Fischer, Garrison Officer of Icelake

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010009.ContentEN:
"Everyone knows Phoxichor in portable canisters tends to leak over time. Sure, we've optimised the container to minimise that — we really did our best. But if you want a fully sealed casing, the materials alone would cost more than the Phoxichor inside. Don't like it? File a complaint with Materials. But that's not the point. The point is — we told the quartermaster these things expire after two years. Technically, though... they could last three."

"What's your point?"

"The time has come — it's been two years. Anyone fancy grabbing some 'expired' Phoxichor from the Legion depot?"

"...You're a genius! No wonder your lab never files requisitions."

— Anonymous alchemist, overheard at a secret tea party, as collected in Gatherings Under the Night-Blooming Jasmine

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010010.ContentEN:
"A nameless bloom. An unloved species. Maybe someone once cherished it — briefly — before casting it aside. Legend claims it was once a person, punished for defying the gods: stripped of name, of love, of all goodness, and every thread of hope for tomorrow. And yet... it still blooms. Everywhere. Flowers do not speak. But it seems even the gods could not truly silence this one."

— Mendir, Master Gardener, Flora, Flow, and Fate

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010011.ContentEN:
"The Sacral Bellflower always droops its head. Shaped like tiny trumpets, it's neither rare nor hard to grow. In Elysium, it symbolises humility, and is said to be a messenger of the divine — delicately whispering sacred teachings to all beings. It's believed that if you listen beneath its blooms for a full day and night, you may earn the blessing of the Great Nine. That said, I wouldn't recommend trying it — the pollen clings to your clothes and is nearly impossible to wash out."

— Mendir, Master Gardener, Flora, Flow, and Fate

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010012.ContentEN:
"SKREEEEE!!!!!!"

— An enraged mother bird, mid-peck at an egg thief

RESOURCE_TEXT_4010013.ContentEN:
"In Hyperborea, pickled mushrooms are the most cherished side dish during the long winters. In Huaxu, people of all ages head into the mountains after rain to forage for them. In Luca, meat-sauce coil pasta and creamy mushroom ribbon pasta are practically half our national faith — (the other half, according to a colleague of mine, being pizza without fruit). In Elysian families, no gathering is complete without a plump mushroom pie. And in Aethyrie, mushroom cake is said to spark inspiration — always sold out come exam season. We travelled the continent in search of good food, but what we found far exceeded our expectations."

— Wym, food journalist from Luca, A Taste of Atlasia

RESOURCE_TEXT_4020001.ContentEN:
"Squeak, squeak, squeak, squeak, squeak..."

— A foraging squirrel trying to crack an Ironshell Nut

RESOURCE_TEXT_4020002.ContentEN:
"Squeak, squeak, squeak, squeak, squeak... SQUEAK!!!"

— A foraging squirrel that has just cracked an Goldshell Nut

RESOURCE_TEXT_4020003.ContentEN:
"Work hard today, live in comfort for the rest of your days!" 

— Motivational sign in the Silverite mine

RESOURCE_TEXT_4020004.ContentEN:
"Work hard today, live in comfort for the rest of your days! 

Note: Unauthorised possession of Silverite and Lumite is a capital offence."

— Updated motivational sign in the Silverite mine

RESOURCE_TEXT_4020005.ContentEN:
"Troubles to stones, 'plop, plop' as they go, where they're gone from sight, in Lamenting Lake they're beyond." 

— A folk ballad of Icelake

RESOURCE_TEXT_5011010.ContentEN:
Tidewanderers follow the seasons like clockwork, setting off on their great migration the same month each year, no matter how rough the seas. In honour of their uncanny punctuality — and to better profit from it — coastal folk began forging clock hands in the shape of a Tidewanderer.

— Dylan the Know-It-All, Unknown Corners

RESOURCE_TEXT_5011020.ContentEN:
Back in the day, its gaudy colours and spiny back had fishermen mistaking it for something venomous. Most just dried it out and sold it as a decorative specimen. Then some brave soul with more guts than sense gave it a try — and before long, Prismspikes started gracing dinner tables across the continent. As for those flashy spines? Just another kind of unrecyclable waste.

— Fiama, designer, Refractions

RESOURCE_TEXT_5011030.ContentEN:
In every seaside town, you'll find Silverslip on the New Year's table. In some regions, there's a tradition of hiding a silver coin in the fish's belly — and whoever finds it is said to enjoy good fortune all year long.

— Dylan the Know-It-All, Unknown Corners

RESOURCE_TEXT_5012010.ContentEN:
Its diet is so absurdly varied that parents in fishing villages often use it to teach their kids a life lesson: "A long life starts with an empty plate."

— Dylan the Know-It-All, Unknown Corners

RESOURCE_TEXT_5012020.ContentEN:
Not the brightest type of fish, honestly. Fry often mistake other large fish for their parents. With the right technique, you could have one trailing behind you for quite a while — just be careful not to get bitten when the real parents show up.

— Harriet, nature writer, World Beneath the Waves

RESOURCE_TEXT_5012030.ContentEN:
Tired of scrubbing shellgnarls one by one? Ditch your old brush and gloves — and say hello to the Pull & Spin Shellgnarl Washer™! Bulk cleaning made easy — no fuss, no scraped knuckles. Comes in two sizes: a handy 1-litre model for home use, and a 10-litre industrial beast!

— A poster outside a general store

RESOURCE_TEXT_5013010.ContentEN:
"According to workplace safety regulations, a Fangnome bite doesn't count as an occupational injury. I'm afraid I can't approve your sick leave."

— Burt, supervisor of Icelake Urban Maintenance Office

RESOURCE_TEXT_5013020.ContentEN:
"A thoroughly unappetising species — both to us and to other fish. I once saw a Bonegnaw Eel take a bite and spit it out straight away, like it was saying 'yuck' — which is a rare reaction for a fish, mind you.
The Nomnom was fine, physically speaking — but then it just floated up, belly-first, nice and slow. Yes, it literally scared to death."

— Harriet, nature writer, World Beneath the Waves

RESOURCE_TEXT_5013030.ContentEN:
"I've got a Mr Leggy trapped under a bucket. Now... how do I get it out of the house without lifting the bucket?"

"...! Ahem. Old Martin, I'm staying at Ms Camilla's tonight. Don't wait up."

— A conversation between a daughter and her father

RESOURCE_TEXT_5021010.ContentEN:
Back on Purgatorio Island, we called it the "Guiding Star." They say its glow lasts forever as long as you care for it — much like a star forever shining in the sky. My father caught this one the day I was born. The years have blurred so much, but not this. It's still there — glowing, steadfast, right where my story began.

— Abigail Morley, a seafood trader in Luca

RESOURCE_TEXT_5021020.ContentEN:
Fresh Tidechaser is best eaten raw. The taste doesn't just hit your tongue — it shoots straight from your teeth to your brain. In that moment, you feel the flick of its tail, the ocean parting in its wake. And most who are lucky enough to try it, without fail, say the same thing: "You can really taste the life in it!"

— Ethans, food critic, Eat It, Love It, Know It

RESOURCE_TEXT_5021030.ContentEN:
Chasing freedom means taking risks.

Just look at it — born a fish, but dreaming of the sky. For one fleeting moment, it tastes freedom... And the next? Snatched midair by a seabird for lunch.

— A Purgatorio Island parent, mid-lesson

RESOURCE_TEXT_5021040.ContentEN:
Yes, yes — I know I should've given it a more taxonomically accurate name. But come on — who could call this adorable little thing a "shell-less snail"? I mean, just look at it! A puffy little bundle of joy, right!?

Hmm... puffy... puff... sea... Seapuff. Yes. That's the one.

— A passionately insistent marine biologist

RESOURCE_TEXT_5021050.ContentEN:
A captive soul, long steeped in weary gloom,
Needs no hard hand to tumble into doom.
The sea, though dark, would make a fitting grave —
Yet divine light bloomed beneath the deepest wave.

The sundered boughs of Heaventree were wings,
Their leaf-born hymns, the veil that grace brings.
Through depths unknown, I heard Their distant call,
And felt my shattered form rise — not to fall —
...but back towards life once more.

— Excerpt from The Saga of Torrential Grudges, by Alexander Dumas, a mourning faction playwright

RESOURCE_TEXT_5022010.ContentEN:
The beast towered over twenty feet tall — fanged, clawed, steeped in bloodlust. In the blink of an eye, it struck again. But the Yingtian Marshal had already moved. Not a word. Not a breath. The blade rose — then fell. A clean arc cleaved through the creature's snarling face.

What a blade! Thus lauds the verse:

With Pearldrop hide the hilt is bound, firm in his hand.
Forged by master smiths, the blade he doth command.
Heaven-blest, sworn to repay, he makes a solemn vow:
For the Argent Dragon's honour due, thy head must fall ere now.

— Excerpt from Chronicles of Yingtian, a Huaxu storytelling classic

RESOURCE_TEXT_5022020.ContentEN:
We still don't know how this species developed such particular taste in housing — but picture this: hundreds of metal casings, each sprouting jointed limbs, scuttling across the beach in swarms... Burned into my memory, no doubt. Though it would've been nicer if they hadn't tried to pinch my toes.

— An anonymous veteran explorer

RESOURCE_TEXT_5022030.ContentEN:
Though this species does eject sand in short bursts, it bears little resemblance to the mythical creature "Yuu" described in early Huaxu writings. 
The expelled sand is demonstrably non-toxic, and the naming may well be a case of ancestral misattribution — or simple mythological conflation. Most likely, the original "Yuu" never existed at all.

— Lin Caocao, biologist from Huaxu

RESOURCE_TEXT_5022040.ContentEN:
In ancient times, fishermen believed that the Pearllure's glowing lure was none other than the fabled Night Pearl itself. But once the creature perished, its radiance faded swiftly — and thus arose the old Huaxu proverb: "The bright pearl dims when cast astray."

— Rovetta, travel writer, Rovetta in Huaxu

RESOURCE_TEXT_5022050.ContentEN:
Twincrest Sharks have eyes that diverge, never quite meeting in focus. In their long-standing feud, the Jishu and Xuanheng sects seized even this quirk as fuel for mockery. The Jishu jeered that the Xuanheng "saw no one but themselves," so blind were they with pride. The Xuanheng retorted that the Jishu, like flatfish, were "short-sighted to the point of absurdity."
Unknowing is the creature — yet in human hands, its name becomes a blade.

— Lin Caocao, biologist from Huaxu

RESOURCE_TEXT_5023010.ContentEN:
Toothache keeping you up? Go catch a Phoxene. Boil it — not that it'll help. Then bite down hard. That bad tooth of yours? Pop — gone on its own. Works every time.

— Icelake's Tooth-Pulling Trick (Guaranteed to Hurt)

RESOURCE_TEXT_5023020.ContentEN:
The Lady of the Lake is far more dangerous than her beauty suggests. Even while on the hunt, it moves with breathtaking poise. One "kiss" — and even prey several times her size falls limp. Strangely, it is never been known to harm a human. In fact, it has even been spotted sharing its surplus catch with fishermen from time to time.

— Harriet, nature writer, World Beneath the Waves

RESOURCE_TEXT_5023030.ContentEN:
This fish died twice — once in the kitchen, and once more on the plate. I've had bad fish before, but this? Easily a new number one. Off the table. Start over.

— Ethans, food critic, judging at a cooking competition

RESOURCE_TEXT_5023040.ContentEN:
Technically, it has a long-winded academic name — but most people still prefer the nickname given by a washerwoman over the official term coined by biologists.

— Dylan the Know-It-All, Unknown Corners

RESOURCE_TEXT_5023050.ContentEN:
I watched it go — one scar at a time, it shed the past. It had grown strong, outgrown the bounds of the bathtub. And for the first time, it swam free — its glowing spine tracing a ray of light across the open sea.

— Consul, novelist, Gleamspine in the Sewers

RESOURCE_TEXT_5024010.ContentEN:
In dazzling hues, it weaves through tide,
Iridescent scales in ripples glide.
In solitude — a beauty unmatched, serene.
In pairs — all grace gives way to spite unseen.

— Nameless poet, Ode to the Iridescentscale

RESOURCE_TEXT_5024020.ContentEN:
Legends speak of an immortal Wishen said to predate memory itself. Over countless ages, the weight of unforgotten thoughts swelled its head, round and heavy. At last, unable to bear the burden, it cried out to the Argent Dragon for aid. The celestial dragon answered by casting its memories into the sea. Steeped in seawater, those fragments became squids with large, swollen heads. And as the memories dissolved, the Wuyousheng's form grew ever fainter... until, at last, it was reborn as a child — unburdened, unbound, ready to begin anew.

— Qiu Ci, folklorist from Huaxu, Tales of the Grain

RESOURCE_TEXT_5024030.ContentEN:
Death by improperly prepared Thornbearer — a classic modus operandi in Huaxu detective fiction. And in stories like these, the sleuth often delivers this line with icy resolve: "Though the Nine Chapters of Dafeng name no law for your kind, justice shall still be done!"

— Rovetta, travel writer, Rovetta in Huaxu

RESOURCE_TEXT_5024040.ContentEN:
Each year, the Pouchcarp is among the offerings prepared for the Argent Dragon. Restaurants across Huaxu compete fiercely for the honour — in what has become the famed "Pouchcarp Cook-Off," a culinary contest where chefs showcase their skills through this beloved local fish. The winner, chosen by popular vote, earns the honour of preparing dishes for the Argent Dragon's feast.

— Rovetta, travel writer, Rovetta in Huaxu

RESOURCE_TEXT_5024050.ContentEN:
First toast to the Lord of the Sea — Calm the waves, and bring us all home safe.
Second toast to the Lord of the Sea — Fill our nets with fish, shrimp, and clam.
Third toast to the Lord of the Sea — Grant fair winds and fruitful harvests across the land.
Fourth toast to the Lord of the Sea — May fortune, health, and long life be ever yours!

— Sea Blessing Chant of Huaxu Fishermen

RESOURCE_TEXT_5025010.ContentEN:
The Mousling Fish often serves as a convenient snack for larger predators, leaving it extremely timid. Even the faintest disturbance sends it scurrying into the nearest corner. If you plan to keep a few, be sure to provide plenty of hiding spots in your aquarium.

— Harriet, nature writer, World Beneath the Waves

RESOURCE_TEXT_5025020.ContentEN:
"This time, the manager finally approved my sick leave. I showed up with the Bonegnaw Eel still clamped on my arm — thing was thrashing so hard, it slapped a whole splash of sewer muck right in his face."

— Yoan, sewer cleaner

RESOURCE_TEXT_5025030.ContentEN:
"This material exhibits remarkable elasticity and water resistance. In time, it may allow for the creation of instruments capable of functioning at great depths — perhaps even those that could reach the Heaventree's buried roots. And with them, we may yet trace the origins of the world."

— Emerald, Materials Researcher at the Aeolipile, Principles and Instructions for Use of New Materials

RESOURCE_TEXT_5025040.ContentEN:
"Ee—ya! Ee-ya—ha! Ha→ha→ha↓ha↑"

— An attempt by local residents to mimic the eerie laughter echoing through the sewers

RESOURCE_TEXT_5025050.ContentEN:
Never, ever — ever — go head-to-head with it. Where your eyes can't reach, its kin are already watching from the dark...

— A widely repeated warning

RESOURCE_TEXT_5110100.ContentEN:
A thousand casts a day — that's just the basics for any beginner. And by the time you're done, even if you've caught no fish, you'll at least have the arm of a decent swordsman.

— A veteran angler who prefers to stay anonymous

RESOURCE_TEXT_5110200.ContentEN:
Remember: even a cooked duck might fly off — so how much easier for a live fish to escape? Until it's flopping in your basket, down to the last second, the last breath... it's not truly yours.

— A veteran angler with a rueful smile

RESOURCE_TEXT_5110300.ContentEN:
Fish I desire, and bear paws I desire too. But if both can't be had — well, if no fish will bite, I'll take the paws.

— A veteran angler sharpening his knife

RESOURCE_TEXT_5110400.ContentEN:
I remember — it was just past midnight. A Lamenting Lake Trout had taken the bait. Couldn't see a thing, but I knew it had to weigh at least eight kilos. Too bad my rod snapped clean in half through the fight! But hey... that's fishing. It's not about the catch — it's a kind of spiritual practice. A test of patience. The result doesn't matter. Honestly, I'd forgotten all about that night... until you brought it up. Anyway — check out this new rod! Solid as a rock. Unless it's the Lake Monster itself, nothing's breaking this one. Hehe...

— A teary-eyed veteran angler

RESOURCE_TEXT_5110500.ContentEN:
"Whoa! Got one! I caught a fish! Haha!"
"Are you blind!? That fish's on my hook! Get your line off my Limited Edition, Cinder-Certified, Iridescent Master Rod — right now!"

— A veteran angler (briefly joyful), and his unlucky friend

RESOURCE_TEXT_5210100.ContentEN:
A true master angler needs only one rod, one bucket, and a deft hand.

— A veteran angler with an empty creel and not a crumb of bait left

RESOURCE_TEXT_5210200.ContentEN:
Plenty of anglers raise their own bait. It's economical, convenient, and efficient. Just... make sure the lid on your bait box is tight. I mean really tight.

— A veteran angler buying insecticide

RESOURCE_TEXT_5210300.ContentEN:
Variants are fish that went a little... sideways. No telling what they'll bite. Honestly, I'm starting to think they remember more than three seconds — it's the only way to explain why they keep circling that same scrap of metal every time I toss it in.

— A veteran angler suspiciously favoured by variants

RESOURCE_TEXT_5210400.ContentEN:
"Run! It's the Master of Chumming!"

— A veteran angler, fleeing for dear life

RESOURCE_TEXT_99.ContentEN:
"Heaventrees, their branches aglow with crystalline fruit, once bathed the southern towers in silver light. From that radiance, humanity's earliest faiths took root. A millennium later, scholars in pursuit of the trees' secrets distilled from them a substance known as Phoxichor — the very essence of their light. Thus began Atlasia's age of Blue Gold and whirring gears. Once more, mankind stood at the cusp of transformation... The history of Atlasia is — and has always been — the history of Heaventrees."

— Tachitus, Elysian Historian, Chronicles

RESOURCE_TEXT_CANCELPHANTOM.ContentEN:
"Child, do not revel in companionship nor weep at parting, for we are but fleeting moments in time."

— Lady Nifle, Ferrywoman of the Misty Sea

RESOURCE_TEXT_MUSIC.ContentEN:
"When your fingers brush the keys, the notes awaken — the wind's whispers, time's soft sigh, the hush of new shoots breaking soil. They give voice to ancient histories, to heroes' unspoken vows, to tales never etched on any page. They stand as testament to all that has ever been upon this land."
 
 — Lirico, the Wandering Bard

RESOURCE_TEXT_PHANTOM.ContentEN:
"Our tale spans over two millennia: a saga of embrace and massacre, of furore and mercy. History ebbs and flows like the celestial dance of the sun and the moon – constant and cyclical. In the grand tapestry of time recounted in these pages, I am but a mere observer, as insignificant as a flake of Hyperborean snow, a leaf from Aethyrie, a drop in Luca's waters, or a grain from Khemet's sands. Yet, in this immense cosmos, I harbour the hope that snowflakes will forge snowfields, leaves will form forests, drops of water will coalesce into rivers, and grains will gather to sculpt deserts. As all singular entities unite, history shall pivot in our favour."

— Betwixt Leaves And Branches — History of Atlasia, by Comnena, Chief Librarian of the Aethyrie Cloud Cavern Library

RESOURCE_TEXT_ROOT.ContentEN:
"You have three lives.

Your first life is breath and heartbeat. You measure and perceive the world with your flesh and blood.
Your second life is connection and bond. Your soul dwells in the nourishment of family, a lover’s kiss, and the embrace of friends.
Your third life is thought and memory. When a reader sees your name upon a page, when a traveler hears it in a bard's song, when a child draws wisdom and courage from your story—your life echoes once more in this world.

All return to the Misty Sea, but not all truly die."

— Lady Nifle, Ferrywoman of the Misty Sea

RESOURCE_TEXT_daoren.ContentEN:
"The essence of swordsmanship lies in the unity of the wielder's spirit. With utmost focus, one can cleave through the mightiest foes, be they ocean waves or leviathans."

— Excerpt from The Art of the Sword, by a nameless swordsman from Huaxu

RESOURCE_TEXT_gongbi.ContentEN:
"Supple, yet strong — just what you need for a proper bow."

— Lunosmith

RESOURCE_TEXT_gongshen.ContentEN:
"A bow that can't hit its mark is just a fancy stick! There's got to be a way to improve its accuracy."

— An unnamed bowyer

RESOURCE_TEXT_gongxian.ContentEN:
"Sturdy, with just the right amount of give. I daresay it'd make quite the stylish weapon in the hands of an assassin."

— An unnamed novelist in search of inspiration

RESOURCE_TEXT_qiangguan.ContentEN:
"I know everyone here likes to think of themselves as artists, but seriously, you're all a bunch of morons. What you do is simply alchemy, medicine, or drawing. What's the point of obsessing over the meaning of life or the consequences of your work? Check out this new gun I made — awesome, right?"

— Nisaya, Weapon Master of The Aeolipile

RESOURCE_TEXT_qiangji.ContentEN:
"The trigger is the most crucial part of any mechanical device. Even from a developer's perspective, I can tell you — no matter how intricate the internal workings are, it's just a piece of scrap if the trigger doesn't function properly. Trust me, I speak from experience — if my trigger had jammed back then, I wouldn't be here today."

— An unnamed veteran traveller

RESOURCE_TEXT_qiangshen.ContentEN:
"Sure, the legion gives us some freedom to customise our weapons, but painting my gun pink? That's where I draw the line! I don't care if you're my sister, that's still a no. And take that teddy bear charm off!"

— Lynn, an officer of the Hyperborean Legion

RESOURCE_TEXT_shiwu.ContentEN:
"What's so bad about being different? People are always bending over backwards trying to prove how unique they are. Me? Ha, I was born an outcast, a natural oddity shunned by Father Ask, the most bizarre ornament in the tribe!"

— "The Raven" Chaos, from The Forsakens

RESOURCE_TEXT_wobing.ContentEN:
"He is advancing,
He is advancing!
I hear his thunderous steps resound,
I hear the Sword of Torrent scrape on the ground!
He shall claim the lives of the unjust,
No one here can escape the tempest!
None can resist death's looming tonight,
Nor wrest the sword from his grasp so tight!"

— Excerpt from Le Rhapsodie de Torrent, by Alexandre Thomas, a mourning faction playwright

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_101.ContentEN: Dealing damage with a melee weapon has a <Highlight>10%</> chance to inflict 1 stack of <Highlight>[Molten Blaze]</> and increases the target's Damage Taken by <Highlight>2.5%</> for <Highlight>5</>s, up to <Highlight>10</> stacks.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_102.ContentEN: <Highlight>[Molten Blaze]</> deals periodic damage equal to <Highlight>15%</> of the character's ATK to the target once <Highlight>per second</>.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_103.ContentEN: Grants 1 stack that increases the duration of <Highlight>[Molten Blaze]</> to <Highlight>10</>s, up to <Highlight>20</> stacks.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_104.ContentEN: Targets with <Highlight>[Molten Blaze]</> take 1 <Highlight>[Molten Blaze Sabre]</> effect every <Highlight>5</>s. Dealing damage with Melee Weapon has a <Highlight>10%</> chance to trigger an additional <Highlight>[Molten Blaze Sabre]</>. [Molten Blaze Sabre]: Deals <Highlight>563%</> of the character's ATK Damage.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_201.ContentEN: Increases Auto-Pickup Range. Immune to Hitstun for <Highlight>3</>s after picking up an item.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_202.ContentEN:
When dealing damage with a ranged weapon, there is a chance to trigger [Seaborne Moon].
[Seaborne Moon]: Deals AoE Damage equal to <Highlight>1350%</> of the character's ATK 1 time and spawns <Highlight>3</> [Mini Seaborne Moons]. This effect can only be triggered once every <Highlight>10</>s. 
[Mini Seaborne Moon] is regarded as a pickable item. Picking it up restores HP, Sanity, and Ammo.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_203.ContentEN: Picking up a [Mini Seaborne Moon] grants 1 [Veiled Moon]. A maximum of <Highlight>6</> [Veiled Moons] can exist at the same time. Dealing Ranged Weapon damage consumes 1 [Veiled Moon] to fire a [Stinger], dealing AoE Damage equal to <Highlight>270%</> of the character's ATK.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_204.ContentEN: When [Veiled Moon] is consumed, it turns into a burst of <Highlight>3</> [Stingers]. When successfully picking up any items, grants 1 stack of [Phantom Drift] that increases Ranged Weapon Damage by <Highlight>6%</> for <Highlight>15</>s, up to <Highlight>10</> stacks.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_302.ContentEN: Grants 1 stack of <Highlight>[Gleam]</> per second, up to 60 stacks. Using skills at 60 stacks of <Highlight>[Gleam]</> removes all stacks and enters <Highlight>[Radiance]</> state for <Highlight>10</>s, during which Skill Damage is increased by <Highlight>50%</>.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_303.ContentEN: When in <Highlight>[Radiance]</> state, <Highlight>[Emission]</> is triggered once every 2s, dealing damage equal to <Highlight>810%</> of the character's ATK to enemies within a <Highlight>6</>-metre range.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_401.ContentEN:
Increases Detection Range and Damage Range of <Highlight>[Lumiseed]</> and <Highlight>[Lumileaf]</> by 100%. 
<Highlight>[Lumiseed]</>: Detonates when detecting enemies within <Highlight>3</> metres, dealing damage equal to <Highlight>600%</> of the ATK.
<Highlight>[Lumiseed]</> lasts for <Highlight>10</>s, with a maximum of 10 existing at the same time.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_402.ContentEN:
When summoning <Highlight>[Lumiseed]</>, there is a <Highlight>40%</> chance for it to evolve into <Highlight>[Lumileaf]</>.
<Highlight>[Lumileaf]</>: Detonates when detecting enemies within <Highlight>3</> metres, dealing damage equal to <Highlight>1000%</> of the ATK.
<Highlight>[Lumileaf]</> lasts for <Highlight>10</>s, with a maximum of 10 existing at the same time.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_403.ContentEN:
When <Highlight>[Lumileaf]</> detomates, summons 1 <Highlight>[Lumiwood]</> at its current location. 
<Highlight>[Lumiwood]</>: Heals teammates within a <Highlight>10</>-metre range by <Highlight>5%</> of their Max HP per second. <Highlight>[Lumiwood]</> lasts for <Highlight>10</>s, with a maximum of 1 existing at the same time.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_404.ContentEN: Increases the chances of summoning <Highlight>[Lumiseed]</> by 100%. <Highlight>[Lumiwood]</> deals damage equal to <Highlight>650%</> of the ATK per second to enemies within range.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_501.ContentEN:
When performing Helix Leap, there is a <Highlight>30%</> chance to create a <Highlight>4</>-metre <Highlight>[Powder]</> field on the ground for <Highlight>5</>s. A maximum of <Highlight>1</> [Powder] field can exist at the same time.
<Highlight>[Powder]</> field deals damage equal to <Highlight>270%</> of the character's ATK per second to enemies within range.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_502.ContentEN: Increases <Highlight>[Powder]</> field duration to <Highlight>10</>s and allows <Highlight>2</> [Powder] fields to exist at the same time.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_503.ContentEN: Increases <Highlight>[Powder]</> field radius to <Highlight>8</> metres and allows <Highlight>3</> [Powder] fields to exist at the same time.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_504.ContentEN: When dealing damage, the <Highlight>[Powder]</> field deals an addtional instance of damage equal to <Highlight>12% × Character's ATK × Max Sanity</>.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_601.ContentEN: The maximum number of [Glimmerfly] <Highlight>+1</>, and they gain the ability to deal AoE Damage within a <Highlight>2</>-metre radius.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_602.ContentEN: When [Glimmerfly] is around, there is a <Highlight>30%</> chance to obtain a <Highlight>large</> variant, dealing AoE Damage equal to <Highlight>700%</> of the character's ATK within a <Highlight>4</>-metre range.

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_603.ContentEN: The maximum number of [Glimmerfly] <Highlight>+1</>. When a <Highlight>large</> [Glimmerfly] hits a target, it splits into <Highlight>3</> <Highlight>small</> [Glimmerflies].

RLBlessingGroup_Desc_604.ContentEN: When [Glimmerfly] deals damage, inflicts 1 stack that permanently increases Damage Taken by <Highlight>12%</> on the target, up to <Highlight>5</> stacks.

RLTreasure_Desc_Unknown.ContentEN: This Artefact remains shrouded in mist

RLTreasure_Desc_Unlock.ContentEN: This Artefact remains shrouded in mist.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10101.ContentEN:
Her candlelight chases the chill, painting hope and smiles on children's faces. Yet all mortal flames must die, so again and again she lights new candles. 
In the sacred lake's depths, a wicksmith forged an eternal flame - only to find no one left waiting in the darkness for her light.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10102.ContentEN:
Each time they meet, the bird-masked Illusionist would complain: "Fixed prices suck all the fun away! Where's the thrill of chance and mystery?" 
The merchant takes the advice, scattering discount coupons he designed for his shop through the abyss. The Illusionist shakes his head in dismay: "Your kindness makes for poorer entertainment than your business."

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10103.ContentEN: She is the most devout of believers, aligns every word and deed meticulously with divine doctrine, maintaining perfect piety even when no mortal eyes could witness. To the struggling she extends aid; to the destitute she gives generously; even to dissenters she offers patient counsel, urging them to appreciate the Great Nine's mercy.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10104.ContentEN:
"What if the gods aren't as perfect as you believe? Would your devotion still matter?" people challenged. 
"Of course," she smiles serenely. "True faith seeks no reward, it disciplines. So long as my actions align with my conscience, what difference does it make whether the gods are real or righteous?"

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10105.ContentEN: It is a hymn known to all—praising the merciful gods who guide lost souls. Devout believers of Elysium hum its heart-wrenching melody in the abyss, begging the gods to lead them from suffering to the promised land. The gilded melody carries them into eternal slumber, still dreaming of salvation.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10106.ContentEN:
Abyssoids close in from all sides. The Knight charges alone into the darkness, carving a path of hope. After the Abyssoids recede, the Healer Priest drags the Knight's broken body from the black void. 
"I will save her," the Healer Priest vows. To mend the wounds of the valiant is a healer's duty.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10107.ContentEN:
The road ahead is arduous, and the truth always hurts. When the evening bell rings, why does the wandering bird refuse to return to its nest? 
Because he knows no tower marks the Continent's center, no gods hold all the answers. He chooses to walk his own path, even if it means wearing shackles for life.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10108.ContentEN:
"Every gain comes at a cost." This cliché becomes intriguing in a game setting. 
The Illusionist tosses his toy ball into the box. "Good news or bad news first?"

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10109.ContentEN:
"Every gain comes at a cost." This cliché becomes intriguing in a game setting. 
The Illusionist tosses his toy ball into the box. "Good news or bad news first?"

"Every gain comes at a cost." This cliché becomes intriguing in a game setting.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10113.ContentEN:
"Every gain comes at a cost." This cliché becomes intriguing in a game setting. 
The Illusionist tosses his toy ball into the box. "Good news or bad news first?"

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10114.ContentEN: As you journey onward, don't forget the brave little companions who follow you into the abyss. Crack open a treat to reward their courage!

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10201.ContentEN: Water, rations, a flint… and a crumpled map. Its owner once tried tracing their path with charcoal—lines crossing, overlapping, even spilling beyond the map's edges. The marks spiral into futile circles before stopping abruptly, leaving only a crooked question mark.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10202.ContentEN: Water, rations, a flint… and a crumpled map. Its owner once tried tracing their path with charcoal—lines crossing, overlapping, even spilling beyond the map's edges. The marks spiral into futile circles before stopping abruptly, leaving only a crooked question mark.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10204.ContentEN: O twin-faced deity, hear our prayer—may blades clip these white wings, may daggers pierce this beating heart, that we might transcend this false fate and await the full moon reverse its course.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10205.ContentEN: The little caged bird, damned and restless—no pillow of leaves, no dreams at sundown, not even death may grant you peace. So wake up—bite into suffering, swallow pain whole, and watch fate raise its hands in defeat.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10206.ContentEN: To master your craft, first find your purpose—then pursue it with relentless focus.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10207.ContentEN:
When others bow their heads, lift your eyes. When others kneel, stand tall. When others praise, question. When others rejoice, rage. 
Only then will you break the chains of the full moon and see the truth fate hides.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10209.ContentEN: The bird longs to soar, but the abyss knows no sky. It seeks a branch to rest but finds only fear's gnarled limbs.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10210.ContentEN: Lost in cycle after cycle, despairing with each faltering step—direction gone, time undone, self erased. The weary traveler trudges through endless darkness, accompanied only by loneliness and dread, unaware that in the deeper shadows, a pair of eyes silently traces their every move.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10211.ContentEN: A note slipped into your backpack at some unknown hour. Perhaps you should be more cautious. Fortunately, it bears neither poison nor curse, just a sincere blessing: "Safe travels and good fortune! —Your friend"

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10212.ContentEN: All things are interconnected. Applying logic with both induction and deduction may just yield unexpected revelations.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10213.ContentEN: The Flamekeeper Priest is a master of necromancy, weaving dead souls into his power. To him, the deceased are allies… until the abyss. Whose shadows stretch in candlelight? Why do their souls scream in torment? And why… did they tell him to turn back?

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10214.ContentEN: The Flamekeeper Priest is a master of necromancy, weaving dead souls into his power. To him, the deceased are allies… until the abyss. Whose shadows stretch in candlelight? Why do their souls scream in torment? And why… did they tell him to turn back?

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10215.ContentEN: The Flamekeeper Priest is a master of necromancy, weaving dead souls into his power. To him, the deceased are allies… until the abyss. Whose shadows stretch in candlelight? Why do their souls scream in torment? And why… did they tell him to turn back?

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10216.ContentEN: The Flamekeeper Priest is a master of necromancy, weaving dead souls into his power. To him, the deceased are allies… until the abyss. Whose shadows stretch in candlelight? Why do their souls scream in torment? And why… did they tell him to turn back?

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10218.ContentEN: The Flamekeeper Priest is a master of necromancy, weaving dead souls into his power. To him, the deceased are allies… until the abyss. Whose shadows stretch in candlelight? Why do their souls scream in torment? And why… did they tell him to turn back?

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10219.ContentEN: The Flamekeeper Priest is a master of necromancy, weaving dead souls into his power. To him, the deceased are allies… until the abyss. Whose shadows stretch in candlelight? Why do their souls scream in torment? And why… did they tell him to turn back?

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10301.ContentEN: Water, rations, a flint… and a crumpled map. Its owner once tried tracing their path with charcoal—lines crossing, overlapping, even spilling beyond the map's edges. The marks spiral into futile circles before stopping abruptly, leaving only a crooked question mark.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10302.ContentEN: Water, rations, a flint… and a crumpled map. Its owner once tried tracing their path with charcoal—lines crossing, overlapping, even spilling beyond the map's edges. The marks spiral into futile circles before stopping abruptly, leaving only a crooked question mark.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10303.ContentEN:
"Why save me?" The revived Knight's bulging eyes threaten to escape his ghostly face. "I wanted to die with my soul intact - before the madness took me!" 
Against all healing, he returned to the shadows. The Knight steps back into the darkness, his body barely pieced together by the Healer Priest's tireless care. Who now needs his sword?

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10304.ContentEN: "If that stubborn shopkeeper refuses to change his ways, allow me to provide some special customer care." The Illusionist scattered a deck of cards across the table, backs up. "Go ahead—take your pick, as many as you like!"

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10305.ContentEN: He'd rather be known as "the Illusionist" than "that freak". In this bleak, monotonous void, conjuring joy is his only pursuit—the cost of that joy matters little, for he has nothing left to lose.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10306.ContentEN: Wealth is best in abundance—yet mere accumulation is simply dull. Let riches take nobler forms, let the masses sing praises of my generosity! Accept this gift… and add another verse to my legend.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10307.ContentEN: True knowledge demands a feast of pages—taste every text, or remain starved of understanding.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10308.ContentEN: Truth thrives in simplicity—profound contemplation and careful deliberation can yield invaluable insights even from limited knowledge.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10309.ContentEN: Endless darkness threatens to consume you whole, yet miraculously, a feeble flame flickers back to life from the embers. If the abyss truly has a will… perhaps even it refuses to let your story end here.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10310.ContentEN:
A knight with a silver blade cut through the enemy ranks, his radiance spilling across the battlefield like a rising full moon. The exhausted soldiers stirred once more beneath its glow.
 Ah... the guidance of the Goddess of Fate! Moved by the miracle, the people wept with joy. Faith rekindled strength in weary limbs, and so they rose, following the light into the fray.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10311.ContentEN:
When darkness first defiled the sacred lake, Elysium's bravest knights stepped forth.
 Most never returned. Those who survived lost their dreams forever — the instant their eyes closed, the Abyss reclaimed them, dragging their minds into darkness.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10312.ContentEN:
On the eve of battle, a young knight, brimming with vigour and resolve, donned silver armour to hide the holy markings unfurling like wings across his back. One final victory for Elysium — that was all he asked, before answering the call.
 But the triumph proved hollow. A colossal Filthoid tore through Elysium's lines, and the knight vanished without a trace. Some say wings carried him skyward, forsaking his homeland. Others believe the Dark Moon claimed his mind, and he became one with the beast.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10313.ContentEN:
Her toes brushed the surface of the sacred lake, sending ripples across the water — lightless and still — as though a dark moon were surfacing from the depths. If this lake truly led to the realm of all happiness, why did it not even offer a reflection?
 In an instant, a fierce current arose, and the saint's doubts, along with their very self — were swallowed by the pitch-black whirlpool.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10314.ContentEN:
The noblewoman claimed divine blood coursed through her veins — that she was born to sacrifice herself, to save her people.
 On the day of coronation, she set her long hair alight, transforming the sacred rite into a blazing execution. The temple — and all nobles within — turned to ash. The flames roared heavenward, brighter than the sun. Those toiling below paused in awe to witness the light.
 She burned. She gave. She saved.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10315.ContentEN:
I lived through the age of darkness — when heretics rose as one to bring the Tower to ruin.
 I saw it then: thousands of thorns cascading from its heights, veiling the heavens in thorned shadow. Be not afraid, O faithful. The gods punish only the guilty. When the thorns have strangled every sin, a new age shall rise — blood-drenched, yet radiant with promised grace.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_10316.ContentEN:
She saw the darkness creeping in. But the path was already lost — how could she bear to take anything more from them?
 So she offered a glimmering candy — a fleeting dream, perhaps a lie — anything that might bring a smile to her friend's face.
 If it did, even once, that was enough.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_11101.ContentEN:
At nineteen, war claimed him the moment the claws of a Filthoid tore through a fellow teammate he just met before his shield could rise, leaving a crimson bloom and a faint scratch no scrubbing could erase. 
So what is he still fighting for? For faith, for justice, or just to outrun the past.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_11201.ContentEN:
Fourteen and on his first training day, he selected this sword from the merchant's pile of beginner gear— old-fashioned, his friends teased. "Guns are way more practical!" 
"Knights don't carry pistols," he retorted, hoisting the blade overhead like in the storybooks. "For Elysium!"

RLTreasure_IPDesc_12101.ContentEN: Seek not flawless paths, for wisdom walks between. Strike when the hour is right, or lose what might have been.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_12102.ContentEN: Foolish is he who covets material things, for desire breeds corruption. Let him who would reap first count the cost of sowing.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_12201.ContentEN: Steadfast patience is the highest virtue. Wait as the grass for morning dew, for divine grace shall descend as spring rain. Cast away worldly cares, and walk the radiant path with devout heart.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_13101.ContentEN:
Not gentle glow, nor crackling campfire. 
Like a raging inferno, I will burn through all that stands in my way.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_13102.ContentEN:
Not spring's gentle rain, nor babbling brook. 
I am the tsunami that drowns cities, leaving no obstacle standing.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_13103.ContentEN:
Not a gentle breeze, nor a whispering wind. 
I shall be the howling gale that tears roofs asunder, tearing through all barriers.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_13104.ContentEN:
Not a flicker of light, nor spark in the dark. 
I am the silent thunder splitting the night, striking terror into all who stand before me.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_14101.ContentEN:
Since childhood, she idolized her sister—the brilliant Knight who could conquer any challenge. 
While legends warned that none return alive from the abyss beneath the sacred lake, her sister proved them wrong. 
She lived… in terrible silence.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_14201.ContentEN:
Grown-ups whisper that my sister offended the gods in the sacred lake, so they took a piece of her soul as punishment. 
No, my sister is a true Knight, devout and honorable. Her soul was lost there by accident. If no one else will believe, I'll make them see. 
The abyss awaits, but I will return with the piece missing.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_14202.ContentEN:
Sister… is that you? What happened to you? Why are you pointing your sword at me? 
"Liar... liar..." The dark shadow repeats in a shrill, piercing voice, "There's no justice, only lies." 
It's all coming back to her—her sister's whispered wish to quit the order and live a simple life.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_14301.ContentEN:
The shadow fades as if it never was. At last she sees—her sister's missing piece is gone forever. 
Did my worship become your curse? If I hadn't been so overjoyed when you were chosen, would you still be here? Was it me who ended your life? 
Her sorrowful cries echo in the silent abyss.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_15101.ContentEN:
Why does she drag her battered body through this endless maze, pressing on despite knowing it's all for nothing?
 Because no matter where she hides, Kathy always finds her. Because no matter how absurd the excuse, Flynn never gets angry. Because she still grips that bloodstained badge — heavy with the weight of someone's unshakable trust.
 Because now... she carries something she cannot walk away from.

RLTreasure_IPDesc_15201.ContentEN:
All her life, she's chosen the path of a quitter. She skipped the Sacred Tree Academy's selection, and after joining the knight order, never once sought promotion.
 No one climbs forever. Better to stay where she first stood, than chase a summit she was bound to fall from.

Reading_Content_101223.ContentEN:
(Looks like a scrawled note left behind by a Phoxhunter — the paper's yellowed with age.)

...

This bloody mine's been shut for ages — nothing down here but dust and Filthoids. Wouldn't've come to this gods-forsaken dump if it weren't for two little pests. Had to scrape up some Phoxene just so they could stay in school. Don't see the point in burying your nose in books. When trouble hits, a punch'll sort things faster than any page ever could.

...

Didn't think I'd actually find any Phoxene — let alone this much. Ought to keep those two brats in school a while longer.

...

Place is crawling with Filthoids. Wouldn't take much for someone to get themselves killed out here. Well... since I'm in a good mood, maybe I'll leave a warning for the next poor sod who stumbles through. Might even fix a few busted lamps while I'm at it.

...

Reading_Content_200208.ContentEN:
By the time you read this, we'll already be gone.

The Escort was alerted by what happened to Psyche that night — we could no longer stay in Icelake.
Before their investigation reached Hypnos' House, I gathered everyone and left.

Please do not grieve for us, nor fear that we might harm anyone should Deterioration claim us too swiftly.
We are heading into the wilds, wandering towards distant, uncharted lands.

We don't know what awaits us at the journey's end — perhaps death, or some unforeseen miracle.
Either way, we will hold fast to hope until the very end.
It's what she taught us.

And... thank you, for everything you've done for us.

Take care,
Elisa Taylor

SKILL_110101_DESC.ContentEN: Berenica dashes forward, dealing AoE Damage 4 times along the way.

SKILL_110102_DESC.ContentEN:
Switches the melee weapon to [Ymir] and casts 1 Swordwave.
When performing Normal Attack using [Ymir], unleashes Swordwaves in the attacking direction and constantly consumes Sanity, during which Benerica is immune to Hitstun when taking damage. Once Sanity drops to 0 or the skill is used again, [Ymir] is sheathed.

SKILL_110103_DESC.ContentEN: When dealing damage with [Faintlight] or Sword, there is a chance to restore Sanity for Berenica.

SKILL_110104_DESC.ContentEN: After using [Netherflames], the next use of [Faintlight] will not consume Sanity.

SKILL_110301_DESC.ContentEN:
Deals Umbro Damage to enemies in front and inflicts 5 stacks of [Adagio] on them, up to 10 stacks. The remaining time of the effect is refreshed with each new stack gained.
When in [Bestial Fury] state, this skill is replaced with [Aria].

SKILL_110302_DESC.ContentEN:
Enters [Bestial Fury] state and continuously consumes Sanity; when Sanity drops to 0, [Bestial Fury] state ends.
Weapons can not be used during [Bestial Fury] state. 
Melee Attack is replaced with [Furious Claws], performing up to four consecutive attacks to deal Umbro Damage. When used in the air, Phantasio performs Plunging Attack and deals Umbro damage to enemies within range.
Ranged Attack is replaced with [Mournful Howl], firing an energy beam to deal Umbro Damage.
When the 3-hit of [Furious Claws] and [Mournful Howl] deal damage, triggers [Duo]; when the 4-hit of [Furious Claws] and the Plunging Attack deal damage, triggers [Fermata].

SKILL_110303_DESC.ContentEN:
When in [Bestial Fury] state, increases Attack based on Phantasio's Max Sanity.
Phantasio gains [Immersion] by using skills, with the [Immersion] cap equal to Phantasio's Max Sanity. Using [Recitativo] or [Aria] gains a certain amount of [Immersion]; when in [Bestial Fury] state, continuously gains [Immersion] per second.
When [Immersion] reaches its maximum in [Bestial Fury] state, Phantasio enters [Bestial Fury: Devotion] state.

SKILL_110304_DESC.ContentEN: When the 3-hit of [Furious Claws] and [Mournful Howl] deal damage, there is a chance to inflict 1 [Adagio] stack on the target.

SKILL_150001_DESC.ContentEN:
<H>[Only effective when deployed as a Combat Partner]</>
Increases ATK for the character and their nearby Lumino teammate(s).

SKILL_150003_DESC.ContentEN:
<H>[Only effective when deployed as a Combat Partner]</>
Increases ATK for the character and their nearby Lumino teammate(s).

SKILL_150101_DESC.ContentEN: Lunges forward, dealing Lumino AoE DMG 3 times along the path, then slams down to deal more Lumino AoE damage.

SKILL_150102_DESC.ContentEN:
Switches the user's melee weapon to [Samael], dealing Lumino DMG to enemies ahead. While wielding [Samael], Sanity drains continuously. When Sanity reaches 0 or the skill is used again, [Samael] is withdrawn.
 Normal Attacks with [Samael] chain up to 4 hits.
 While wielding [Samael], hold the skill button to charge — Sanity is consumed over time. Releasing the button, reaching max Combo Level, or running out of Sanity unleashes a powerful Charged Attack, dealing Lumino AoE DMG to enemies ahead.
 While charging, gains [Impatience], generating combo points every 0.5s.

SKILL_150103_DESC.ContentEN:
When Combo Level increases, deals Lumino DMG to nearby enemies and enhances [Samael].
 At Combo Levels C/B/A/S, [Samael] gains Enhancement Lv.1/2/3/4 respectively. If Combo Level drops, the current Enhancement Level persists for a short time.
 While [Samael] is enhanced, the user's Consonance Weapon gains increased ATK Range and Trigger Probability based on the Enhancement Level.

SKILL_150104_DESC.ContentEN: Unleashing [Samael]'s Charged Attack at Combo Level S extends [Impatience] duration.

SKILL_150203_DESC.ContentEN:
Based on Lady Nifle's Ranged Weapon Trigger Probability, there is a chance to summon 1 additional [Lunar Hunt] when summoning [Solar Eclipse] at the same location, and vice versa.

The additional summoned [Solar Eclipse] and [Lunar Hunt] will not be enhanced by [Misty Sea Requiem].

SKILL_150204_DESC.ContentEN: [Solar Eclipse] can trigger "Bonus Effects: Lumino," while [Lunar Hunt] can trigger "Bonus Effects: Umbro."

SKILL_150211_DESC.ContentEN:
Creates 1 [Lunar Hunt] and replaces this skill with [Solar Eclipse]. 
 [Lunar Hunt]: Deals Umbro Damage to all enemies within range upon spawn and reduces their Movement Speed.

SKILL_150301_DESC.ContentEN:
Deals Lumino Damage to enemies within range 3 times and increases Kezhou's Ranged Weapon Attack Speed.

While in [Aspect Manifestation] state, increases Kezhou's Melee Weapon Attack Speed, during which Kezhou is immune to Hitstun when taking damage.

SKILL_150302_DESC.ContentEN:
Enters [Aspect Manifestation] state and summons [Edges of All Times] to rain from the sky, dealing Lumino Damage to enemies within range.

While in [Aspect Manifestation] state, Kezhou's Melee Weapon becomes [Phanosword]. When triggering Bonus Effect using [Phanosword], generates 1 [Phanoplume].
While in [Aspect Manifestation] state, this skill is replaced with [Feathers Chase Dust In Dreams].

SKILL_150303_DESC.ContentEN:
Begins with 50 points each of [Sword Intent] and [String Intent] (maximum 100).
 [Sword Intent] increases Melee Weapon Damage Dealt and Melee Weapon Trigger Probability, and reduces the Sanity Cost of [Lightswords Slice Starry Streams]. At maximum [Sword Intent], Sanity Cost is further reduced by 20.
 [String Intent] increases Ranged Weapon Damage Dealt and Ranged Weapon Trigger Probability, and reduces the Sanity Cost of [Feathers Chase Dust In Dreams]. At maximum [String Intent], Sanity Cost is further reduced by 20.
 Each time damage is dealt with a ranged weapon, 1 point of [String Intent] converts into [Sword Intent]. Each time damage is dealt with a melee weapon, 1 point of [Sword Intent] converts into [String Intent].

SKILL_150304_DESC.ContentEN:
Upon entering [Aspect Manifestation] state, records the current [Sword Intent] points. For a period of time, if the [Sword Intent] point drops below this value, the [Sword Intent] effect applied to [Life's A Fleeting, Shifting Tide] will adopt the recorded value instead. This effect is invalid after exiting [Aspect Manifestation] state.

Upon ending [Aspect Manifestation] state, records the current [String Intent] points. For a period of time, if the [String Intent] point drops below this value, the [String Intent] effect applied to [Life's A Fleeting, Shifting Tide] will adopt the recorded value instead. This effect is invalid while in [Aspect Manifestation] state.
